description.summary: The Luxury Lake House is located near some of the area's finest restaurants, wineries, breweries, and golf courses. Bring your golf clubs and fishing poles along, as our property features an expansive lake front with excellent catch and release, providing a serene and picturesque setting to appreciate the beauty of the area and an unmatched view of Robert Trent Jones Golf course. The Lake House is a wildlife habitat and it is not uncommon to see wild animals and farm animals on the property.

description.house_rules:
We kindly ask you to read our house rules carefully and keep them in mind during your stay.

1. Please no shoes inside the house. 
2. No unregistered guests or visitors allowed. If you planning to invite the guests or visitors to the property you must have permission from the host and receive approval. At any one time, there cannot be any more than the specified number of registered guests, in the booking details, in or on the property. A violation could lead to the immediate removal of all guests without a refund. 
3. No parties. Please keep their noise level to a minimum after 10 pm and before 7:00 am; sounds travel through the walls extremely easily. Your neighbors are long-term residents and they may call authorities. Any disturbance triggering a visit by police will require immediate eviction of all guests from the property. No refund will be given for the unused portion of the guest's stay. 
4. NO SMOKING. Strict no smoking policy inside of the apartment or by the entrance door to the apartment. If you're a smoker that's ok, just please smoke in the designated smoking area located by the driveway. There will be a $300 (Smoking fee) charge if this rule is not followed. 
5. Please respect check-in and check-out times. Check in is after 4 PM and Checkout is before 11 am. Late Check out Fee of $100 (if not authorized by the host) applies for check-outs after 11:00 am. We're sorry we have to charge this but we pay our cleaners based on the agreed-upon checkout time and if they are unable to clean, we still have to pay them. If you need a bit more time to finish the check-out process, let us know in advance so that we can warn our cleaners about a shift in the cleaning schedule. 
6. Please don’t eat or drink in the bedrooms. 
7. Do not anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products or baby wipes should be flushed at any time. If we determine that feminine products or any other item other than toilet paper has been flushed and these items clog the system, you may be charged damages up to $500. 
8. Please turn off the AC when you go out.
9. Please take care of the furnishings. You have to pay for damages that exceed the security deposit. Please don’t rearrange the furniture.
10. Please do your dishes.
11. Please take the trash out before you leave.
12. No illegal substances allowed on the premises.
13. Commercial photography/videography without written consent, illegal activity, prostitution, and possession of firearms is strictly prohibited. 
14. No packages or mails sent to this address. If you want to receive a package or mail at this address, you must have permission from the host and get approval. 
15. Booking a reservation constitutes a renter agreement to sign and comply with the House Rules. Guests who violate these rules are liable for any associated damages, fees, costs, or expenses.

Plus only a short drive from "civilization" if you need anything from a store or restaurants or whatever.

Great experience

Truthfully, I did get a little lost finding the cabin, but Justin’s instructions were very helpful and clear. Absolutely loved and adored the peaceful place, will definitely book again in the future🥰 10/10 recommend.
This place was absolutely perfect for a weekend away from the city and Justin was extremely accommodating, even giving us a discount for tubing down the river! Highly recommend.

description.summary:
Comfy Tiny Cabin located just a few steps from the rivers edge. Enjoy hanging out on the floating docks taking in the scenic views. Throw a line in and do a little fishing or hop on the canoe and go exploring. Finish the day out with a game of Cornhole or just sit back and relax around the fire.

**Train tracks above to the left a little. MARC train runs in the morning and evening. Freight train runs sporadically throughout the day**

hosts.about: Dee & I, have been in the Hospitalty business for 7 years, and it’s been a great journey. We’ve met people from all over the world, and always look forward to provide our guests with best experience, service and privacy.

Welcome to our profile! I'm Talya, your warm and friendly Airbnb host, committed to making your stay comfortable and enjoyable. With over 8 years of experience in the hospitality industry, I pride myself on providing a genuine, personalized experience when you choose to "stay with Talya."

As a seasoned traveler, I understand the importance of feeling at ease in a new place. That's why I've carefully crafted my cozy abode to offer all the amenities you need, along with a touch of local charm. My attention to detail and dedication to making your stay unforgettable sets me apart as a host.

During your visit, I'll be delighted to share insider tips on the best local spots to explore, dine, and relax. Whether you're here for business, leisure, or a combination of both, I'm always available to answer any questions or offer assistance.

So, get ready to embark on your next adventure with confidence, knowing that when you "stay with Talya," you'll be greeted with open arms, a comfortable space, and a truly memorable experience.

hosts.about:
Warm Greetings! Hello! Namaste!

I am a young professional from the Washington, D.C. area who works in management consulting industry. I specialize in strategic communications and change management. 

Favorite activities include hosting guests on AirBnB, reading, writing, gardening, travel, cooking food from around the world, spending time in nature, stargazing, museum/art gallery visits, national park visits, library and bookstore hopping, antiquing, and nature/wildlife conservation. 

I value kindness, empathy, intercultural understanding, family, good friends, intellectual curiosity, and a positive outlook on life.

Namaste!

I am Suraj. My story began in Nepal, a small and beautiful country known for its majestic Himalayas, lush valleys, ancient temples, and warm hospitality. I love connecting meaningfully with people from all walks of life and corners of the world. Having lived, studied, and worked in countries across Asia, Europe, and North America, I chose to call the DC area home. I enjoy traveling, cooking mean curries, and collecting eclectic art.

description.summary: The Shanti Home & Garden is a beautiful, cozy gem tucked in a leafy neighborhood. You will be pleasantly surprised at how peaceful it is, despite being conveniently close (10-25 minutes) to the major attractions across Washington DC, Arlington, Alexandria, and National Harbor. Restaurants, cafes, stores, gyms, trails, grocery, bus stops, and Capital Bikeshare are within walking distance. It is perfect for your getaway, family/friends vacation, staycation, business trip, and remote working.
description.space:
The Home:
Nestled in a garden, the Shanti Home welcomes you with tons of charm and sunlight. It has split-level layout with 2 separate living rooms decorated with unique, eclectic arts and crafts curated from different corners of the world. 

-1st level has a living room equipped with a Smart TV for your entertainment. Also located on the 1st floor are a full bathroom and a laundry room. 
-2nd level (half flight of stairs from 1st level) has another living room, dining area, and full kitchen.
-3rd level (half flight of stairs from 2nd level) has 3 bedrooms and another full bathroom. 

There is a private driveway for parking. 

The Garden:
Nature lovers rejoice! The garden provides fresh air, tranquility, and complete privacy. A safe habitat to birds, bunnies, chipmunks, and squirrels, this garden has evergreen trees. 

You will find 2 climbing rose plants here whose parent plant survived Hurricane Katrina in Louisiana. Marigolds that originated from Nelson Mandela’s house garden in South Africa bloom in summer. At the back corner of this garden, there is a Bamboo grove with prayer flags from the Himalayas of Nepal—an ideal spot to relax, meditate, and/or reflect. 

During the day, you can sunbathe, picnic under Cherry and Japanese Maple trees, and nap in the hammocks. As night falls and stars appear, the patio string lights create a warm and dreamy ambience for you to relish in.
description.access: You will have keyless entry. The whole house and garden are all yours to enjoy.
description.notes:
We have been blessed with great neighbors. We thank you in advance for helping us maintain the peace and tranquility of our neighborhood. 

Parties, events, and/or gatherings of unregistered guests are all strictly prohibited. Any violation(s) will be promptly dealt with.
description.interaction: For us, providing warm hospitality to our guests is a way of life. Our goal is to provide you with a relaxing and memorable stay. description.summary: Our contemporary studio guest suite has everything you need for your Arlington trip. Perfectly set up for business travelers and visitors alike. Private entrance with open sleeping area, Wi-Fi, self check-in, and free parking. During your stay, enjoy a full kitchen and private bathroom. Our Airbnb is within walking distance to several popular restaurants, parks, and bus routes. An ideal base to explore Arlington.
description.space: The suite offers a full size bed, bathroom with rain shower and heated floors, open concept kitchen with Nespresso Coffee Maker, toaster, GE microwave, refrigerator/freezer and stove. Kitchen fully stocked with utensils, dishes and tools. Enjoy access to your very own private washer/dryer. Flatscreen TV with Amazon Fire stick also included.

description.notes: Directly in front and across the street is free street parking. We just ask that you don’t block any walkways. The suite is located on the lower level and you can expect to hear us from time to time, but we will do our best to make your stay as peaceful as possible.
description.neighborhood: You’ll be one block away to several walking/bike trails, parks, tennis and basketball courts, and open soccer fields. Four blocks away from our neighborhood grocery store (Safeway) and local eateries such as, Arlington’s best Neapolitan style pizza “Pupatela” and Salvadoran Pupuseria “La Union”. 5 min Uber/bus ride to “Ballston Quarter”, where you can find a plethora of restaurants, coffee shops, and shopping.
description.transit: 1/2 block away to a bus line, 2 blocks away to a Bike share, a 5 min ride to Ballston Metro and 15 min Uber ride to downtown DC.
description.interaction: We love meeting new people and entertaining guests, but respect everyone’s privacy. Meet us on the side patio for a sparkling water or glass of wine. Otherwise, enjoy a private stay, but please let us know if you have any questions or need anything.
description.house_rules: Please do not leave dirty dishes. Shoes off are highly encouraged. Quiet hours from 12am-6am.

recent.comments: Ginger’s place is a lovely and modern basement apartment with all the amenities you might need and more. Would highly recommend to anyone!

items.comments: Ginger’s place is a lovely and modern basement apartment with all the amenities you might need and more. Would highly recommend to anyone!
Ginger was a wonderfully responsive host. We appreciated staying in a clean and comfortable space. We enjoyed our stay!
Another great stay at This immaculate studio.  Highly recommended.

Very clean and nice place to stay. The other negative was that it was very loud downstairs from noises upstairs in the main unit. Not a major deal, but would be problematic for those that plan to stay in the u it throughout the day or are super light sleepers.
Perfect location for me, quiet street, apartment was spotless, it had everything I would need and more, a real bargain!  Would definitely stay there again!

We loved our stay at Ginger and Omar's apartment! It was clean, beautiful, and they were so kind and friendly. They were also very understanding of my kids being loud. Highly recommended . We'd love to stay here again!

We really enjoyed our stay. I didn't cook any meals but the kitchen was well stocked and had everything you would need. We didn't use the  projection TV but it looked really awesome.  The bed was great. Shower, no tub. It is on a dead end street. We were able to park with no problem each night. It is 1.4 miles to the Ballston MU metro. My daughter didn't want to walk so we drove to the Ballston city parking garage each day and parked there. It's a 5-7 min walk to the metro station. There were a lot of bad reviews for that parking garage on-line but I didn't have any problems. I was able to pay with cash one day and credit card two days with no issues. And it was really reasonable. $1 for 2 or 3 hours up to $10 for an entire day. It is a basement apartment so you will get some noise from the floor above periodically. But again, we were out each day all day so it wasn't really an issue for me. Most importantly (to me) - Ginger was extremely responsive.  It was very clean and cheery!

description.summary: Welcome to our cozy, convenient Arlington apartment! This brand new one bedroom basement apartment is tucked into a quiet Arlington neighborhood, just a few blocks from miles of walking/biking trails and a twenty minute drive to the monuments of DC or a twenty minute walk to the restaurants and entertainment of Ballston.
description.space:
This is a newly constructed, bright, very modern basement apartment with a separate entrance. We've worked to equip the apartment with everything necessary to ensure that you have a comfortable and relaxing stay, including plush linens, a beautiful fully-equipped kitchen, gourmet coffee and tea, snacks, and a projector TV. There is a queen-sized bed in a private bedroom with a large closet and a full-sized futon in the living room. There are a variety of puzzles, books, and board games to entertain.  There is a brand new private patio with a table and chairs if you want to have a glass of wine and relax at the end of the day. We want to make family stays as easy as possible, and are happy to provide baby/toddler necessities free of charge at your request, including a Pack n' Play, infant tub, booster seat/high chair, books, and toys.

If you want to venture outside, the apartment is just a few blocks from Bluemont park and three of Northern Virginia's best biking/walking trails. 

Please Note: 
This is a basement apartment and we live upstairs with our two young children and our dog. We’ve  provided a white noise machine in the bedroom, but you will likely hear us during the day. This apartment is probably not suitable for people who are light sleepers and late wakers or who are very sensitive to sound.
description.access: You will have sole access to a full one bedroom basement apartment with private entrance, large bedroom with queen bed, fully equipped kitchen,  living room with futon, and private bathroom (with shower).
description.notes:
As mentioned above, this is a basement apartment and our family lives upstairs, so if you prefer a location with total silence, this may not be the best accommodation for you. We ask that our guests book with this understanding. 

We love hosting returning guests, so we offer a 10% discount off of the nightly price for returning guests. We also offer a 5% military discount (with ID).  We have weekly, monthly, and non refundable  discounts, as well. Please note that discounts cannot be combined.
description.neighborhood: Quiet neighborhood 20 minutes from DC, with access to the W&OD trail, parks, tennis court, playground and walking distance to Ballston Quarter Mall and Ballston Metro station.
description.transit: 20 minutes walk to Ballston (and Ballston Metro stop), 20 minutes drive to DC,  ART Bus stop a few houses away. Capitol Bikeshare station a few blocks away.
description.interaction: If you need anything from us during your stay, please don’t hesitate to ask. We’re right upstairs and happy to help. We have lived in DC for a combined 30+ years, so we’re also glad to offer recommendations for great local spots. Just shoot us a message on the Airbnb app.
description.house_rules: There is no garbage disposal, and the sink is a sump system. No trash or food scraps down the kitchen sink.

Highlights are a stylish open kitchen with stainless steel appliances, an oversized family room featuring a large Scramble board, a cozy loft perfect for reading, a Peloton for exercising and primary en suite. There is a private deck and large backyard along with a private driveway. Street parking is also available.

It is located one block from Harrison Lee Shopping Center which features Harris Teeter, Safeway, Starbucks, La Moo Ice Cream, Chesapeake Bagel, Duck Donuts, ABC Liqour Store, Sushi Zen, PieTanza and many more shops. Chestnut Hill playground is 3 blocks away. Quick access to Washington, DC and Arlington attractions. 1.7 Miles to East Falls Church Metro. 0.6 Miles to Virginia Center Hospital.

By booking this rental, guests expressly agree to assume all risk of loss incident to their use of the ladder and loft area and to indemnify host from any and all harm that may result to a guest or a guest’s invitees from use of the ladder and/or loft area.

recent.comments: Exactly as expected.

items.comments: Exactly as expected.

Quiet. Clean. Comfortable. Centrally located. We hit the jackpot when the 6 of us (3 adults and 3 young children) stayed here. We had lovely breakfasts and dinner that we made in the well appointed kitchen. The proximity to the East Falls Church Metro Station allowed us to bring the kids into DC quickly and near effortlessly.  We want to come back again since there is so much we were not able to fit in this time.

Charles's house is definitely cozy as described, and had some of the softest linens we've felt in any airbnb.  You can tell he's a techie because the house came outfitted with voice-activated multi-colored living room lights, uber-digital thermostat, video doorbell, and an ultra-widescreen computer monitor in the main bedroom.  Our only negative was an almost non-functional toilet handle that needs repair--an easy fix.  Overall, we loved the stay and would highly recommend it to friends.
I’ve stayed in lots of Air B&Bs, and this one of my best experiences!  Great host, great property, great location, great everything!!  Highly recommended!!!

Charles was very responsive and also work with me to check in earlier than 3pm.  The house is beautiful and clean. Back yard was big and even have a fire pit that you can seat down with family and enjoy it. Neighbors were very welcoming. Will recommend this place to anyone that will love to enjoy Falls Church and enjoy Washington DC. Peaceful environment.

We had a great stay!  Charles was always very responsive; from before booking through follow-up after check-out.  The house was clean and comfortable.  We have family in the area and will definitely stay here again when visiting them!

This was a great find in a quiet neighborhood. Parking was easy and the yard is amazing! Bathroom was a bit small, but it was accurately represented. Beds were comfortable and kitchen was very user-friendly. Would recommend to anyone looking for a cozy, family-friendly place to stay.

description.summary:

description.space: The unit is 1100sqft, with 3 bedrooms and 1 bathroom. Fully smart home equipped, with Smart Thermostat, Samsung Frame TV, and Verizon Fios internet. hosts.about:
Hi, I am Caitlyn.

I love to travel, cook, and meet new people. While on my new adventure, I always look for the comfort of home in the places I stay. I love minimalist design, open floor plans and tech that allow me to unwind and relax or remain productive. I feel that a place’s furnishings, use of color and art, and amenities truly invoke a feeling of comfort. I apply this same mindset in providing luxury serviced accommodations to our guests! 

Places that I want to travel next: Mauritius, Abu Dhabi, Glacier National Park in Canada.

At New Hospitality, we design living spaces to inspire new experiences. From the open layout and artistic appeal, to the exceptional amenities and personalized service, we deliver unparalleled experiences for guests. 

Our homes attract a diverse audience - families vacationing, working professionals, couples enjoying a weekend retreat, groups hosting an event or photoshoot, and locals in between homes or looking to unwind and experience luxury serviced accommodation.

We advocate a new way of working that promotes productivity and creative expression. Our homes draw attention to the workspace with artistic touches and desks from Restoration Hardware, plug and play monitors and the highest speed Internet for uninterrupted video conferencing and streaming.

We value our guests’ time and privacy. Guests receive a personalized code for easy self-check in. Our mobile-friendly digital guidebook conveniently familiarizes all aspects of the home, including nearby attractions and our favorite restaurants. Should our guests have questions, they can reach us any time through multiple channels (phone, text, email). 

Here's to an enjoyable and memorable living experience!

recent.comments: We were very pleased and enjoyed our stay. Spacious home, very quiet, safe place. Very well equipped. Everything was so clean. Covered attached garage. Nice neighborhood. The owner was very friendly and responsive. We highly recommend this property!

items.comments: We were very pleased and enjoyed our stay. Spacious home, very quiet, safe place. Very well equipped. Everything was so clean. Covered attached garage. Nice neighborhood. The owner was very friendly and responsive. We highly recommend this property!
Great house! Clean and spacious.

We enjoyed the quiet  and friendly neighborhood.  Everything you need is provided inside the house.   The smart system for AC and keyless entrance is a plus for my group where we had different activities during the days and came home separately.  
We also loved spending time in the living room, very comfy.  Watched many Disney movies on Roku.  The tv setup is very easily turned on and operated.  
The beds are very comfortable, even my husband who has back pain problem had very good sleep. 
Thank you our host, Omar for being responsive and very hospitable to our group.
This is a great place in the Herndon/Reston area! A very quite neighborhood! The house is very comfortable and has everything you want and need on a trip away from home.
We had a great stay in the house.  It was quiet, clean, and in a great location near the airport. Had great amenities for working remotely and nicely decorated too. Would recommend.
Comfortable house in a nice DC suburb near Dulles Airport.  Noise from planes was faint and not objectionable.
We liked the place a lot. It was centrally located for us to see family in Fairfax and Clifton and an easy drive into DC.

description.summary: Stay comfortably in this completely renovated, 2,000 sq. ft. private single family home with 4 bedrooms, 3 full bath, designer kitchen with large center island, office room and attached front loading 2-car garage. Professionally furnished to deliver a high-end living experience for up to 6 guests. Perfectly suited for families and business professionals visiting the D.C. area. Centrally located in Fairfax, VA, minutes to Dulles International Airport (6 miles) and Washington D.C. (24 miles).
description.space:
Sleep easy in the overstuffed queen and full-size memory foam mattresses and enjoy amenities including a modern kitchen with brand new appliances, high-speed wireless Internet via Verizon Fios, large screen televisions with wi-fi ready apps, Netflix, HBO, Amazon Prime and Disney+. 

Other features include:
- Garaged parking for up to 2 vehicles + driveway for 2 additional vehicles
- Dedicated office room with a desk and monitor
- Fully equipped kitchen and coffee station
- Onsite washer and dryer with hypoallergenic detergent
- Extremely safe neighborhood

Entire space plus amenities are included in this rental. Please, make yourself at home.
description.access: Self check-in enabled. Guests will receive a personal check-in code with instructions after a confirmed reservation.
description.house_rules:
- Pets allowed with a pet fee of $250 and please ask management.

- Absolutely no smoking indoors - $500 smoking fee. 

- You must provide an accurate guest count. 

- Commercial vehicles must be approved by management.

- Suitable for children (2-12 years)

- No parties or events – undisclosed guests warrants immediate eviction or additional fees.

- Quiet time after 10pm.

- Lock and secure the property when going out.

- The fireplace is not for use. Any damages resulting from use of fireplace will be the responsibility of the guest.

- Use the supplied candles wisely - put out flames when going out and before bed time.

- Refer to the electronic guidebook provided after a confirmed stay for instructions on proper home use, placement of key items such as fire extinguishers, TV equipment, and areas of interest (restaurants, cafes, etc.) in proximity to property.

- Follow the instructions under the “departure” section of the electronic guidebook when checking out.

- Maintain Cleanliness: Please treat this home as if it were yours and leave the property as you found it. This home is for not events, conferences or groups that want to entertain large parties. We welcome quiet couples or families. If the property is left exceptionally dirty, such as perishable foods left in the kitchen, dirty dishes in the sink, furniture rearranged, or trash not taken care of, there will be an extra fee of up to $500.

- Late Checkout: Unauthorized late check outs will result in additional fees, depending on the time of checkout. We clearly communicate our 10am checkout, and our cleaners’ schedule cannot be changed without penalty to us. If you fail to check out by 10am, unless otherwise agreed, you will be charged half of the nightly rate for the property. Staying past agreed checkout time is considered trespassing.

- Internet/cable: We provide you high speed Internet as a perk.  Any misuse of the Internet, including illegal downloads and copyright infringements will be met with a penalty fine of $50 if discovered.

- Privacy and Safety: This property is equipped with security cameras on the outside of the property. We use these cameras to monitor during check in to verify accurate guest count, and review footage if there is an incident. The cameras are all outside.

This property is equipped with a smart fire alarm and carbon monoxide detector.  Any detection of smoke will alert management by text message.  Please check to make sure stove top and oven are turned off and candle flames put out before going out and bed time.

- Amenity Stock and Restock: We provide enough trash bags, paper towels, toilet paper, and other home items for about 5 days of use. Beyond that, it is the responsibility of the guest to replenish.

recent.comments:
Do you love Nutella? Then this is the place for you!

This is the best room to rent in the Virginia / DC / Maryland area, hands-down!

The room itself is spotless, comfortable, and has everything that you would possibly need. The patio out back is a perfect spot to sit outside and relax!

Wally and his family are amazing hosts! They are very polite and hospitable, and I always enjoy staying with them. They are responsive to requests, and are all-around just great people that will either give you privacy if you want it, or socialize and be incredibly gracious hosts, if you choose to hangout with them.

I have stayed here many times, and I will definitely stay here many more times! I 100% recommend it - book it now!

Very peaceful, comfortable place.  Care has been taken to be welcoming.  We were visiting family and enjoyed a quiet, relaxing space in the evenings.  Thanks for the warm hospitality.

description.summary: We welcome you to join us and relax in your own private Sugarland guest suite only minutes to the Metro, Dulles Airport, Reston and Ashburn.  Enjoy coffee or tea while sitting on a swinging daybed on your private deck surrounded by nature, enjoy an evening sitting by the firepit and then end the night with a peaceful slumber on a luxurious and comfortable King Size bed.  Easy off-street parking for one car provided, with ample nearby street parking.
description.space: Enter through the gate, at the end of the driveway, and follow the illuminated stone path adorned with a wisteria-covered trellis, guiding you to your exclusive entrance. Throughout your stay, relish in utmost privacy, with a dedicated outdoor area, bedroom, and bathroom. The spacious, thoughtfully designed bedroom seamlessly combines functionality and comfort, offering a luxurious retreat tailored to your needs. Immerse yourself in the meticulously curated details, including a one-of-a-kind modern bathroom boasting a sleek shower, unique sink, and agate countertop. Every corner reflects our meticulous two-year design and construction journey, inviting you to embrace a slice of our home's essence.
description.access: Guests will indulge in a lavish private suite encompassing a bedroom, bathroom, small refrigerator, coffee and teakettle, microwave, makeup table, desk, sofa, and a large screen TV with popular streaming services. Our modern and pristine space aims to provide all essential amenities for a seamless travel experience including Highspeed FIOS Wifi. Step outside to discover a serene oasis, featuring a swinging daybed, two reclining outdoor chairs on a covered deck, a spacious firepit with cozy Adirondack chairs, and an outdoor gazebo dining area with a generously-sized table and chairs.
description.neighborhood: New house in an established residential neighborhood in between Reston and Ashburn that feels tucked away in the middle of nature.
description.transit: Easy to drive or Uber from our house.  Two mile ride to multiple metro stations for easy access to DC and short 10-15 minute ride to Dulles Airport.
description.interaction: Your hosts reside on the property and are delighted to accommodate your preferred level of interaction. One of them, a rare DC native, possesses an extensive knowledge of the area and is eager to offer suggestions, recommendations, and address any inquiries you may have. The other host hails from Turkey but has embraced the DC metro area for the past two decades. Embrace the warm hospitality of our home and immerse yourself in the unique retreat we have carefully crafted in the heart of the DC Metro area.

description.summary: Welcome to this private fully remodeled single family home. Offering 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, full kitchen, laundry room, and countless amenities. Perfectly suited for families, and business professionals.
description.space:
Enjoy the comfort and charm of this newly remodeled home, only minutes from Dulles airport and tons of shopping centers. Enjoy your home away from home. 

This amazing home is a one level single family home that has a open floor plan concept. There is 3 bedrooms and 2 full bathrooms. There is tile flooring throughout the entire home besides the bedrooms which has brand new carpet with memory foam padding. There is a queen size bed with memory foam mattress in each bedroom. We also have a twin air mattress there if needed. All of the bedrooms are equipped with a flat screen smart TV. The family room has a large 75 inch smart tv with a wall insert electric fireplace that changes colors and has a heater. High speed internet (500 Mbps) included in your stay for all of your business and personal needs. We have everything in the kitchen needed for you to cook almost all of your favorite home made meals. There is a fully equipped laundry room with laundry detergent, ironing board, and multiple irons available. There is plenty of storage areas and closets in the house. 

This house is a outdoor persons dream. Large size outdoor sunroom with skylights and built in screens, outdoor patio with dining table, propane bbq grill, fire pit area, and a decent size fenced in yard to enjoy.

The driveway holds two cars and there is plenty of street parking. 

**COVID-19 professionally cleaned and sanitized after every guest. Our cleaners follow the strict standards and guidelines provided by the World Health Organization. 

Please, make yourself at home.
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire home. Our home is comfortable and we hope you enjoy your stay.
description.neighborhood: Extremely safe, and friendly neighborhood.
description.interaction: Guests will be able to contact me for any questions.
description.house_rules:
- Pets allowed with a pet fee of $250 and please ask management. 
- Absolutely no smoking indoors - $500 smoking fee. No shoes on carpet. Cleaning fee up to $100 if stains are left on the bedroom carpets. 
- You must provide an accurate guest count. 
- No parties or events. 
- Quiet time after 10pm. 
- Lock and secure the property when going out. 
- Use the supplies candles wisely - put out flames when going out and before bedtime. 
- Maintain cleanliness: Please treat this home as if it were yours. This home is not for events, or groups that want to entertain large gatherings or parties. If the property is left exceptionally dirty, and furniture rearranged there will be an extra fee up to $250. 
- Late checkout: unauthorized late check outs will result in additional fees, depending on the time of the checkout. We clearly communicate our 10am checkout, and our cleaners schedule cannot be changed without penalty to us. If you fail to check out by 10am, unless otherwise agreed, you will be charged half of the nightly rate for the property. Staying past agreed checkout time is considered trespassing. 
- Privacy and safety: This property is equipped with security cameras to monitor during check-in to verify accurate guest count, and review footage if there is an incident. The cameras are all outside. 
- Amenity Stock and Restock: We provide enough trash bags, paper towels, toilet paper, and other home items for about 5 days of use. Beyond that, it is the responsibility of the guest to replenish.

name: Cliffside retreat with spectacular water views
title: McLean, Virginia

recent.comments: We had an absolute pleasure staying at this Airbnb during a family gathering! The home provides a nice blend of luxury and comfort, making it the perfect retreat location. The home is very clean and allows easy access to a spacious deck granting great views of the Potomac River. The front yard is nice and spacious with plenty of room for outdoor activities. There are 2 kitchens with lots of space to cook for large gatherings, 2 living rooms equipped with TVs and couches to seat a lot of people, a movie room with great automatic seats to relax in, and a game room with a pool table and foosball table for some fun. There was certainly plenty of space for our group of 16. All of the bedrooms were nicely furnished with king and queen beds. Also, the service for the house was phenomenal. We had one of our family members lose an earring during our stay. We reached out to the management and they had the cleaning crew do a full search for us. Overall, our stay was excellent - 5 out of 5 Stars!

items.comments: We had an absolute pleasure staying at this Airbnb during a family gathering! The home provides a nice blend of luxury and comfort, making it the perfect retreat location. description.summary: You will love to stay in this beautiful multi-million dollar waterfront estate boasting over 11,000 square feet with awe-inspiring views of the Potomac River, unequaled privacy, and close proximity to nature and culture. This expansive mansion sleeps 16 in 7 bedrooms, 6 full and 2 half bathrooms, hard wood flooring, foyer ceiling, 2-story library, large kitchen, theater, recreational area, 3-car garage, private driveway, fireplaces, and more.
description.space:
This private cliffside retreat is Ideal for large family gatherings and reunions, wedding guests, corporate retreats and meetings, business conferences, travelling golfers, executive housing, or just a general getaway.

Walk down the one of a kind 150+ step staircase to the deck by the Potomac River and see amazing and stunning sunsets and enjoy the beautiful river views while enjoying the best nature has to offer. 

First floor: large 2-story living room with fireplace and amazing water views, unique 2-story library, dining room table, full kitchen and butler’s pantry, (3) bedrooms, sitting area across from kitchen and (2) powder rooms. Walk out decks. Unique circular staircase leads to the second floor as well as lower level. Washer and Dryer are available on this floor.

Second Floor: Three large bedrooms with full bathrooms and closets. Master suite featuring stunning full bathroom with private shower and jacuzzi and walk in closets. Hallway overlooks foyer and living room. Washer and Dryer available this floor.

_____________________________
Lower Level: Full kitchen, exercise room, full bathroom, gaming area, theater

The property accommodates up to 16 guests.

This home is a nature lover’s paradise and is also equidistant to both Reagan and Dulles International Airports, 15 minutes to Georgetown and less than 15 miles from world renowned museums, theaters, and shopping in the Nation’s capital.

3-car garage is available as well as the driveway and spaces across the street
description.access:
Guests have access to the entire house with the exception of the Sauna and Steam Room due to COVID-19 considerations.

Other things to note
Property ideal for corporate gatherings and business travel with high speed WIFI connection. Touch screen Monitor is available to use with a laptop connection for presentations. 

The property has a very close proximity to all of the downtown offices and businesses in Washington DC and surrounding areas.

Smart HD TVs on each floor. Sonos sound system available and Apple TV and Blueray Player available in the theater.
description.notes:
No pets please and no smoking allowed.
No parties and social functions without owner authorization.
description.neighborhood:
10 minutes(4 miles) to Tysons Corner. Tysons Galleria boasts a distinctive collection of high-end retail shops that includes over 30 exclusive-to-market designers. Galleria offers some of the DC and Northern Virginia areas' favorite restaurant and dining options, set alongside an extensive selection of fashion and beauty brands. 
10 miles to downtown DC.

recent.comments: Sparkling clean apartment with well appointed kitchen. Bed was comfy and the area was spacious.

items.comments: Sparkling clean apartment with well appointed kitchen. Bed was comfy and the area was spacious.
It was the perfect month solo stay for me!

Jonnie’s place was great! It just as describe on the listing. It’s clean and walkable to a lot of restaurants and stores near the apartment. Jonnie was fast at responding to my message and was very accommodating. I would stay here again!

Beautiful apartment in an awesome location!!  It was very easy to get to the sites we wanted to visit.  A couple days before our trip, Jonnie sent an email filled with so much helpful information, and she responded super quickly to  questions while we were there.  If we know of anyone going to DC, we will definitely recommend staying at Jonnie’s apartment.  She has all kinds of small touches that make you feel right at home!

My in-laws had a fabulous long weekend. The apartment is perfect for a couple, with a great kitchen and living area and a modern bathroom! The communication from Jonnie about check in, check out, and apartment info was detailed and easy to follow. We will definitely be booking for them again.
Great stay!

We extended our trip for a couple of days so this was booked just a couple of weeks out.  Communication with the host was good, although we never met or saw anyone in person.  The apartment is decorated with Ikea type furniture but was reasonably comfortable.  Kitchen and bathroom are excellent.  Stocked with very basic amenities but all we needed for a two night stay.  Second night got a little stuffy--as noted in description there are no controls for HVAC in the unit and it felt like the AC might have been turned off or raised to a higher temperature.  Since we were leaving in the morning it was not an issue but this type of "English basement" unit could really use it's own split system AC in the summer.  Also, footstep noises from upstairs could be a bit loud at times, but it was quiet at night.  AU Park is a nice area close to American University and many attractions.  It would be a bit cramped for more than two, but in all this is a great hotel alternative for short term stays

description.summary: Stylish and fully renovated garden level apartment located just a few blocks from the Tenleytown/AU Metro and American University.  Fully equipped/stocked kitchen with SS appliances & quartz countertops, luxurious, spa-like bath and porcelain tile floors.  Close proximity to great shopping and dining with easy access to public transportation.  Portable crib available upon request for guests traveling with infants/toddlers.  Guests will be required to show proof of vaccination against COVID.
description.space: Plenty of free, non-permitted street parking is available on the surrounding blocks.
description.notes: The apartment is located in the lower level of a single family home in a charming, residential neighborhood.  A family (the hosts) occupies the upper levels of the home, so you will hear the family living above you.
description.neighborhood: Tree-lined streets and charming brick colonial homes make-up American University Park; however, great shopping, dining and public transportation are within walking distance from the apartment.
description.interaction: We live upstairs in the main house, so it is very easy to quickly respond to guest needs and requests.
description.house_rules:
- Weekday quiet hours are 10pm-7am.
- Weekend quiet hours are 11pm-8am.

description.summary:
Welcome! Thank you for considering staying in my guest suite. Below you can find details about the space.

Please message me with any questions or concerns!
description.space:
The recently renovated guest suite is located on the first floor of my three floor town house. In the suite you will find a full bathroom, sleeping area, kitchenette area, and living room area. There is a private entrance (separate from main living area) with a customized pin to enter. 


Bathroom:

Full sized bathroom with a stand up shower sink and toilet with a heated floor. This space includes complimentary travel sized shampoo and conditioners, hand soap, bath towels, hand towels, and wash cloths.

Sleeping Area:

The bedroom has a full sized mattress on a platform style bed frame. A fan is located above the bed as well as a lamp on the night stand. 

Kitchenette:

This area includes all basic cooking accessories with the exception of a full stove and/or oven. Cooking pans, utensils, and a hot plate are available to cook small meals. Also included: microwave, mini fridge, single cup coffee maker with k-cups, dishes, bowls, mugs, cups, cutting board. A small eating table with two chairs are located off to the side of the countertop.

Living Room Area:

A couch and coffee table with a 65” smart TV mounted to the wall is located in the rear of the suite. Streaming service apps are loaded onto the smart TV ready for you to login to. If needed, there is a pull out couch available. (Please inform me when reserving so that I may put sheets on and provide an extra comforter)
description.access: The laundry room immediately across from the guest space is available for your use. Please try to switch out and remove your finished laundry as soon as it is completed.
description.notes:
OCCASIONAL NOISE WARNING! Please read below  

The heat/AC compressor is located right outside of the unit and has a humming sound from the fan, and is a bit loud when the compressor kicks on and off.

I have two cats in the living space above the guest suite. They have never entered into the suite, however, they do run back and forth sometimes which can be heard through the floor. (Please let me know if it is ever bothersome). Guests with extreme cat allergies may have a reaction from the shared air circulation. 

This is a townhome with residents on both side so normal noises may also occur such as dogs barking/people talking outside.


Small quiet animals are welcome for an extra $60 cleaning fee per week. A $150 security deposit is also required when booking to cover any potential damages for things like scratching, chewing, and urine. There is a fenced in backyard for dogs but please clean up after your pet before leaving. Please inform me prior to booking so that I may request funds.


On premise parking is available for one vehicle. On street parking is also available and is first come-first serve which is available across the street from the townhouse.

Please keep guest count to what was requested when booking.

Smoking is allowed outside only. Smoking indoors will incur a $150 cleaning fee.

The entire suite is thoroughly cleaned and sanitized according to Airbnb’s 5 step enhanced cleaning protocols and CDC recommendations for neutralizing covid. Hand sanitizer and disinfectant will be available as soon as you enter to re-clean anything for your piece of mind.
description.interaction: I live on the two floors above the space and available most days I am home to answer any questions you have either in person, or over messaging.
description.house_rules:
Quiet Hours After 10 PM
Pets require $150 security deposit and an extra $60 cleaning fee

hosts.about:
Hi, my name is Jess. I'm a frequent traveler for both work and personal fun. I'm very neat and usually only ever rent AirBnB as a place to sleep since I'm typically out and about adventuring 90% of the day. Really just a low maintenance AirBnB renter.

I also host in the Northern Virginia Area. Check out my listing if you're ever in need of a place to stay while you're in the neighborhood :)

recent.comments: Fantastic place! Spacious and a little hot upstairs but a great deal

items.comments: Fantastic place! Spacious and a little hot upstairs but a great deal
I think Jessica did an amazing job having everything we need such as the toiletries, cleaning supplies, great wifi service and responding to my messages well.
Spotlessly clean, matching listing description Jessica’s place was lovely. We had a great stay.
Jessica is quick to respond. The house is well kept. Great instructions for check out. They made it simple!

Jessica’s place was in a safe area and very roomy for our family’s travels. We enjoyed the very comfortable beds, but wished that we had had higher in linens.  The biggest issue I had was not being able to cool the upstairs sufficiently despite using all of the tips in the guidebook. For non summer months or for those who like to sleep on the warmer side (74/75 degrees), this would not be a problem.

We had a great stay at Jessica’s. Her home is very comfortable, spacious and clean.  The large, double-headed shower in the master bath was lovely. A mild light over the toilet at night was a nice touch as was the laundry detergent. 
The neighbors were mostly quiet and there was a sand volleyball court right there. Any question we had, Jessica was all over it. 
Thanks!
Beautiful & clean home! Will definitely be booking again when i’m in the area!

description.summary: You and your family or friends are welcome to  this lovely condo. Located conveniently near IAD and a short drive from DCA aiports. One of Virginia's best areas for dining out - A foodie's dream :)

description.interaction: Call or text me if there's anything you may need or if you have a question. I'm here for you and will do my best to make your stay awesome :)
description.house_rules:
HOUSE RULES: 
-No shoes indoors
-No parties
-No pets
-No candles (fire hazard)
-No smoking (fire hazard)
-No illegal drugs
-No illegal activity
-No throwing garbage down kitchen sink drain. Please use garbage cans provided.
-No firearms inside (lots of families in the adjacent properties)
-Use dark towels ONLY for makeup removal (ladies get this request haha)
-Please be considerate to neighbors (reasonable noise levels please especially after 9pm)
-No sharing security codes for safety of guests and property
-Do not access anything in the ceiling storage racks located inside the garage
-Please do not take AirBnB supplies with you upon check out (toilet paper, paper towels, shampoo, etc). We want to make sure there's enough supplies for future guests to enjoy their stay as well. 

Sorry if there's a lot of information. If it's mentioned, it's because guests have done it before (Unfortunately :/) 

-be kind to the cleaning team and try to be tidy as if it is your beloved family member's house. Cleaning team personnel appreciate you :)

Teamwork makes the dream work :)

CHECKOUT PROCEDURES:
PLEASE:
- place used towels in bathtubs for cleaning team
-put dirty dishes in dish washer and start cleaning cycle (detergent located under sink)
-put all trash inside trash cans lined with provided trash bags
-turn off lights and appliances (including closing refrigerator door)
-lock doors and windows (do NOT lock bottom lock of front door)
-turn off heating/cooling (temperature controls located next to kitchen)

*Late check out will incur additional night's charge at the set nightly rate*
**if you require a late checkout or would like to extend your stay, please contact host for accommodation**

description.summary: Located near Washington DC, in the heart of the DMV. Home Sweet Home nostalgia awaits you in this spacious and elegant Airbnb. The property is surrounded by a peaceful neighborhood with shopping centers, restaurants, and convenient places where you can get anything you need within a five-minute walk. In addition, you can also take other transport such as the Metro, RideShares and the famous Pentagon City Station. DCA Airport, National Harbor, and Washington D.C. are also a short drive away.
description.space: It's got four large high ceiling bedrooms with luxury bed brands including Tempepedic, providing magnificent types of rest. hosts.about: I've been in the Arlington, VA area for more than 20 years. It is a great community and close to everything fun. The monuments, Old Town, Bethesda (great restaurants,) Tysons Corner (shopping) and many historical sites. I have worked hard building a financial planning firm from scratch the last 20 years and really love helping people. In my down time, I enjoy DC sightseeing, meeting new people and taking advantage of the nearby hiking and camping. I hope you enjoy visiting our town.

Cozy spot and worked well for our needs (2 families with younger children visiting DC). Fox had been great with communicating from the get go when I had questions. We appreciated having some board games at the house to play with while around. We had easy access to food, stores and spots to catch the metro to get into the city.
We really enjoyed our stay. Fox was a great host who went out of his way to help us use public transportation into DC. His place was comfortable and very convenient.
Fox's place was great and as advertised. We had a great time!

This was an awesome place! We loved how it was located close to DC but very private! Fox is a great host and he was very helpful! He recommended places to shop, eat, and places to explore off of the beaten path. We loved that! The park close to his house was an added bonus! If you are in the DCC area this is a great place to stay!

description.summary:
Enjoy a very clean and comfortable stay with easy access to a beautiful park and walking trails in a serene neighborhood. CENTRALLY located with easy access to all major highways. Located only 10 min away from DC Monuments and 5 min to a ROBUST downtown Arlington NIGHTLIFE with a huge selection of bars and restaurants. Shower water pressure is AMAZING! You’ll LOVE my place because of the location, neighborhood, outdoors space, and HOMEY feel.

 *NOT for parties or heavy drinking and loud music.
description.space:
Metro Stations, restaurants, grocery stores, convenience stores, gas stations, and shopping centers with major chains are all within a mile or less! My place is clean and tidy with GREAT shower water pressure.

There is FREE parking on the street directly in front of the home.

EASY access to DC sights and Reagan National Airport.

This is my secondary residence and it is, of course, decorated with personal items, memorabilia and family photos. Most people enjoy this COMFY and HOMEY environment. You will get the feeling of staying in a warm, friendly,  and WELCOMING DC local destination.

Other 3BR/8 person residences in the area, this close to DC, typically run $350-$500 a night. My place is an incredible value!

(A couple of places may "look" like they charge less however, I do not charge a cleaning fee.)

 *NOT for parties or heavy drinking and loud music. There are outdoor security cameras and if at any point there are more people on the property than registered (max 8) your group will be forced to leave  immediately with no refund. This is AirBnB as well as Arlington County policy.

*NOTE: It DOES NOT matter if you say only 8 are sleeping here. There CANNOT be more than 8 on the property at any time.
description.access:
You will have access to all of the bedrooms, the living room, kitchen, sunporch and outside patio. Front door has an electronic lock and each bedroom has its own key.

If you are a group of six, then each bedroom will hold two. If a group of eight, a queen sized air mattress is available to be set up in the living room or wherever you prefer.

There is one bathroom that will be solely used by your group.

Washer and dryer is not available.

Access to my personal, separate basement apartment/storage area is not available. (Not used for AirBnB guests or any other type of guest.)
description.notes:
I want guests to feel extremely comfortable during their stay, which includes cleanliness. Upon each guests departure, all bedding is washed and dried at the highest temperature. The room is vacuumed and dusted. Bathroom, toilet and shower are scrubbed. Common areas are cleaned, vacuumed and dusted.

I also have spread Diatomaceous Earth under all of the furniture. This is a naturally occurring substance that keeps insects away. It is 100% natural and food grade. I went this route instead of spraying chemicals in the home every month. You may see this fine white powder if you look under furniture. It is not dirt, or mold, or anything of that nature. It is purposely applied.

Also, it is GREAT for killing bed bugs and roaches immediately, before they can multiply, should any guest ever accidently bring them into the home.

If you are in any way concerned about this substance, please read the Wikipedia entry on the subject. It is used in all grain storage in America (so it is in our food) and approved by the FDA.
description.neighborhood:
The house is located across the street from Bon Air Memorial Rose Garden Park. This expansive 24-acre park includes a basketball court, child's playground, 4-mile Run bike/running trail, tennis courts, volleyball courts, baseball diamond, scenic creek, picnic areas with charcoal grills and a large open field.

North Arlington is already one of the lowest crime and safest areas of the country. My home is located on a dead end street so even lower traffic and more safety. Feel safe going for a walk in the neighborhood, a run on the bike path or a picnic in the park.

If it's winter and there is snow, we have some great hills to sled!
description.transit:
There is free parking on the street in front of my home. However, I will need to provide you with a pass. (Please return it upon your departure.) Up to 3 passes are available. If you have more than 3 vehicles, there is unrestricted parking available very close by (within 100 yards.)

Convenient access to MetroBus and MetroRail. It is an easy $1.75 bus ride to Ballston Metro, one mile away. Buses run every 12 minutes during the week from 6am to 8pm. Every 30 minutes before and after that and on weekends. Any #1 bus (1A, 1B, 1E, 1Z) will get you to Ballston Metro. Any #1 bus (1A, 1B, 1E, 1Z) will return you from Ballston Metro. If needed, I can provide you a link to the schedule.

If you will be touring the city using the MetroRail, it is best to purchase a SmartTrip card. Transfers from MetroRail to MetroBus using SmartTrip cards are free. Bus usage without transfer but with SmartTrip card are discounted. I can provide you with more information about getting around DC using public transit. It is a very efficient and enjoyable system to use.

If you wish to drive from the house and park at the Metro, the best station is East Falls Church. There is a large parking lot and it is only two miles away.
description.interaction:
You will not have access to the seperate basement apartment. That is for storage, tools, and repair facilities. It is seperated with it's own entrance. I do not spend any time in the main part of the house so guests can expect full privacy.

I am sometimes in my apartment and available for questions and help. You will not have to worry about your group being quiet. You will not have to worry about noise or disturbance from me.

There is NO shared ventilation from heat or A/C so no risk of airborne spread of viruses.

*NOT used for any AirBnB guest or any other type of guest.
description.house_rules:
A government issued I.D. that matches the name and profile photo of the guest booking is required to be presented upon check-in. This is to protect you from someone hacking your account and fraudulently booking in your name. Unfortunately, this has become a common scam in the AirBnB community. Thank you for your cooperation.

*IMPORTANT* According to AirBnB policy, the number of guests and children MUST be accurate. If you arrive with more guests or an inaccurate count of adults vs children,  your reservation will be immediately cancelled upon arrival. ("Children" is anyone 12 years old and younger.) If you make a reservation, and the number of guests or children changes, it is easy to "modify" your booking before arrival.

If a party is thrown that includes people who are not registered as guests, heavy drinking, illegal drug-use or extremely loud music then you will be forced to leave without a refund.

Amy’s place was well appointed and felt so spacious and homey for our family of 6.  We had a bit of trouble checking in, but Amy responded within minutes and solved the problem which made checking in super easy.  She went above and beyond accommodating us, by updating the fridge and purchasing an outdoor bbq for us during our stay.

The house is spotless with awesome amenities including special make-up removing wash cloths! Amy makes guests feel welcome with these small and thoughtful details she sets the house up with.

Highly recommend!
We had a great time in Arlington/D.C. and the house was great for our family. Amy was kind and very responsive to messages. If we travel back, we would definitely try to stay here again!

LOVE, LOVE, LOVE!!! This is by far the BEST airbnb I have ever stayed In. The beds and furniture are amazing. I did not want to leave! You will not regret staying here, I promise! 
Her home has everything you could possibly think you need kitchen wise. I can’t believe how stocked everything was. I will be recommending Amy’s place to anyone who comes in to the area for a long-term or short-term stay. Beautiful home and adorable neighborhood! The beds are INCREDIBLE!

Amy was a great host. Her home was beautiful and exactly as pictured! She was quick to respond to any of my questions and very friendly. I would stay here again and would recommend this place if your in the area.

description.summary: Welcome to our charming Arlington Colonial, a classic retreat nestled in the quaint neighborhood of Dominion Hills! It's the perfect place to unwind and relax, just a short stroll away from shops and trails, offering the ideal blend of convenience and tranquility. With two metro stops within reach, accessing the vibrant heart of D.C. is a breeze. In just 10 minutes, you can find yourself amidst the iconic landmarks, renowned museums, and bustling city life that the nation's capital has to offer.
description.space:
As you step inside, you'll be greeted by tastefully decorated living spaces blending traditional and modern elements, providing a comfortable and stylish environment for your stay!

Upstairs, there are three beautifully appointed bedrooms and one full bathroom. On the main level you'll find a large family room featuring a convenient pull-out queen couch, providing additional sleeping accommodations. There is also a fully stocked kitchen, large dining room space, and additional seating options in the formal living space. 

Some special highlights of the home include:

- Workout equipment including a "Studio Mirror" (a smart fitness mirror)
- High Speed Wifi with designated workspace 
- Fully equipped kitchen 
- Spacious and private backyard 
- Access to parks, trails, and tennis courts
- 5 minute walk to Dominion Hills Shopping Center
-15 minutes walk to Westover Shopping Center where highlights include:
             *The Italian Store (highly recommend their subs and pizza and Illy coffee)
              *Westover Market and Beer Garden
              *Dogwood Tavern
              *The Westover Farmers Market is on Sundays from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. 
               during the summer (May-November) and 9 a.m. to 1 p.m. in the winter 
               (December-April). The market is at 1644 N. McKinley Rd. just north of 
               Washington Blvd. We have around 30 great vendors selling fresh 
               produce, herbs, cut flowers, grass fed meats, dairy products, baked 
               goods, and other prepared foods.
description.access: Please let us know in advance if you'd like access to a Washer and Dryer as it's located in the basement which is otherwise locked.
description.neighborhood: Dominion Hills is a quaint neighborhood made up of post World War 2 colonials located 10 minutes outside Washington, DC. Walk to parks, playgrounds, Dominion Hills shops, Westover, Bluemont tennis courts, and multiple trails (Washington and Old Dominion Trail, Four Mile Run, Custis Trail.)
description.transit:
-Ride share apps such as Lyft and Uber are readily available
-Multiple public bus stops within walking distance
-1.4 miles to East Falls Church Metro
-1.8 miles to Ballston Metro
description.interaction: As your host, I will always be available for you throughout your stay. Please don't hesitate to reach out with any questions or concerns!

-Please don’t rearrange the furniture.

-Place things back where you found them.
-Please park in the driveway or DIRECTLY in front of the home

hosts.about: Hi I'm Julia: I started hosting in 2013 after I converted my townhome in Georgetown / Palisades of Washington, DC into two unique Airbnb units that are available when I’m not home. I now have two additional ways to enjoy this space: Rent the entire home or just a private room. New addition for 2023 is Chesapeake Houseboat Getaway on Kent Island, MD. Please check it out!

recent.comments:
We returned to stay at Julia’s Comfort Hollow for the second time. 

The place is very clean, exactly as described, and very convenient visiting the area. 

Highly recommended for a solo traveler or a couple.

items.comments:
We returned to stay at Julia’s Comfort Hollow for the second time. 

The place is very clean, exactly as described, and very convenient visiting the area. 

Highly recommended for a solo traveler or a couple.

This place was so cute and peaceful. Extremely close to Georgetown University, which made it easy for me to walk or drive over to campus. Very clean and had everything I needed. Julia was very helpful and communicative. Will definitely stay here again!!

If you are looking for a safe, secure, clean, and updated studio with efficient host in the Georgetown area then look no further! Julia’s place is just as described and check-in was seamless & there is free parking available and street parking too. The area is quiet and a few miles away from downtown Georgetown but there are bikes, mass transit and plenty of Ubers to get you going to your destination. Highly recommend!
A great stay and wonderful host.  A great location to bike into the city
The host was very responsive and very friendly. Great, cozy place to stay with amazing surroundings.
Very nice stay. Julia was amazing and responsive. Cozy neighborhood in the Georgetown section of DC

This is a beautiful basement apartment in a beautiful neighborhood that is ideal for people with a car or willing to take taxis/uber (it is not in walking distance of central DC and public transportation is not ideal). It is very clean, modern and has all the amenities. My visit was marred by the fact that for two of the four nights, what I assume were Julia's teenage children were up late (well past midnight) talking, laughing and walking around on the floor right above the apartment. I suggest confirming with Julia that won't be a problem before booking.   Other than that, I recommend staying here.

description.summary: Brand new fully refurbished English Basement Studio Apartment in the Georgetown/Palisades neighborhood of Washington, DC. Perfect for a single visitor or couple here for pleasure, business, or a Georgetown University course.
description.space: Private basement studio apartment with outside entrance. Our home is very comfortable and located in a very quiet part of town, especially considering our proximity to the heart of Georgetown! It's the perfect mix of city and privacy. In 2014 we totally renovated the back patio so it is a great place to relax and grill out and watch for the occasional deer to pass by.
description.access: Patio space and outdoor grill are shared with upstairs owners and guests.
description.notes:
This is a basement apartment and therefore subject to noise from upstairs. If you are highly sensitive to noise, I suggest you book another place or a hotel.  There is no washer or dryer in your space, but use of the upstairs washer and dryer MAY be available upon request.

Although our street is a cul-de-sac and is usually quiet we do get airplane noise from flights coming into Reagan National Airport. The planes fly over the Potomac River and we are close to the Potomac River. It is not all the air traffic, they (Reagan National Flight controllers) mix it up and adjust to weather patterns and it quiets down in the evening.
description.neighborhood: Our neighborhood is a gem for anyone who enjoys a touch of nature in the city. We are close to Georgetown University, the C&O canal tow path and Capital Crescent Bike trail, Georgetown and Palisades neighborhoods. There is no Metro in Georgetown but we are a quick walk to a Metro bus stop. There are also e-bikes, and other rentable transportation at the Hardy Recreation bus stop. There are also DC circulator buses in Georgetown taking you all over the city for one low daily price. Finally if you don't mind a walk, the Rosslyn metro station is 1.1 miles away across the Key Bridge about a 25 -30 minute walk.
description.transit: You may use public transportation by bus or walk to the metro, there are Capital Bikes to share and you will be close to hop onto bike trails. Uber and Lyft are very reasonable and quick. There is also a private bus company called the DC Circulator which is very reasonable and has routes all over the city and into Arlington, VA.
description.interaction: I have a detailed guest book with restaurant and activity suggestions for your convenience. I am also happy to help guests get acquainted with the area when I am home and I am ALWAYS available by phone or text once booked.
description.house_rules:
- Keep music and TV to low levels after 10PM.
- Use of the fireplace is a privilege, any manipulation of fireplace logs or gas settings will result in forfeit of security deposit. Fireplace is not an ashtray and will result in forfeit of security deposit. You agree to notify host immediately if you have any questions about how to use fireplace.

name: The Loft at Sneaky Fox Farm
title: Leesburg, Virginia

recent.comments: Beautiful property and even better rental unit above the barn's first floor.  The unit was very quiet, clean and relaxing.  Fit our needs perfectly for a wedding weekend.

items.comments: Beautiful property and even better rental unit above the barn's first floor.  The unit was very quiet, clean and relaxing.  Fit our needs perfectly for a wedding weekend.

Our stay here was great! Clean and spacious. We loved the farm setting.  We were greeted by friendly donkeys when we got there. The horse stables are right below the Air B&B.  You can walk right in the stables and pet the horse's noses.  There are also some friendly pigs outside that like to be pet.   The owners brought out some of the horses to put them in one of the fenced in areas so we could watch them play, graze, and pet them over the fence.  The property is huge with some interesting horse trails you can walk. We had beautiful sunsets then used the fire pit that had a huge wood pile beside it. It was a great place to stay! Highly recommended.

Sometimes you wonder if all the things people write are true or if people have a lot of family and friends staying and writing reviews. I have zero connections to the owners, and everything said previously (all the good) is true. This place is magical and Rita and her family have gone out of their way to ensure that the loft is absolutely pristine and ready for guests. Rita is a pleasure to communicate with and ensured that we had all of the information that we asked about prior to our arrival. The rooms were lovely and had just every amenity that you could want for. 

The barn and surrounding area was bucolic. The animals (donkeys and horses) a joy to interact with. The barn is impressively clean and the animals are all obviously loved and well cared for. 

I would gladly return and will actively seek opportunities to do so in the near future.

My friends and I had a mini reunion weekend, and we had an incredible time at Rita’s farm stay! The spot was beautiful and definitely lived up to the photos. In fact, the apartment itself was even larger than it seems in photos. There were so many thoughtful touches inside, like snacks, toiletries (even mouthwash!), and farm fresh eggs that we requested beforehand. The guidebook inside was also super helpful! 

You can tell that no expense was spared in this rental. I usually don’t expect much from air b&b kitchens, but this one was fully equipped and well stock with high quality items. The cute dishware and marble countertops felt luxurious! 

Rita was also kind enough to allow us to use the pool (also beautiful!) and bonfire. We asked a lot of questions throughout our stay, and Rita was always helpful, responsive, and friendly.

One of the best Airbnb’s I’ve been to—highly recommend this relaxing and unique space!
We had a great stay! The place is adorable and super clean. Beautifully decorated. The host was very responsive and helpful.
What an awesome place to get away. Beautiful place. Rita was awesome. We would definately stay there again.

Our stay at Rita's place has exceeded all expectations. The barn loft is spacious, clean and decorated with love and eye for detail. The surroundings are beautiful and peaceful - perfect to unwind. Both Rita and her husband stood out as hosts. They were helpful, super responsive and provided excellent personal recommendations for restaurants and things to-do in the area. My kids were super excited about their stay at the sneaky fox farm and Rita and Dave went out of their way to make their stay even better, spending so much time with them with the animals (who were super nice too  by the way). Extra remark: this may be the cleanest and tidiest farm I have ever seen.

description.summary:
We are close to Morven Park, Rose Hill Manor, Downtown Leesburg, White's Ferry Manor

Pool is open May-Sept

Retreat away to scenic Sneaky Fox Farm, a newly-constructed barn apartment which sits above our working horse farm. We are conveniently located less than 5 minutes from Historic Downtown Leesburg and within minutes to Loudoun’s best wineries and breweries. Our property offers the feeling of abundant open-space all the while being a stone’s throw away from all that Loudoun has to offer.
description.space:
Sip your morning coffee on the side porch while looking out onto our tranquil pastures. 

We constructed this space from a hay loft to a beautiful barn apartment in 2020. There is a queen size bed in the bedroom and the couch pulls out to a second queen sized bed. This loft is set up for guests to stay and revel in the beautiful natural world of Loudoun County, including a fire pit, quaint side porch, grill, and nearby Balls Buff Battlefield for hiking. Nature and animals are quite literally at your front steps.

The loft sits directly above our barn so you may hear noises such as snorts, brays, and neighs. Our mini pigs and donkeys are noisy mostly at feeding time. 

If animal noises, smells, and the occasional insect are not your thing, this space may not be the right place for you. We invite our guests to experience the activities of our working horse farm, including joining us to experience feeding the horses which occurs every morning and evening.  Farm fresh eggs are available on request as long as the girls are laying! 

During the summer months, arrangements can be made separately to use our in ground swimming pool.
description.access: The loft is located above the barn and is it’s own dedicated space
description.notes: During certain months of the year we attend horse events and can be in barn in the early morning (sometimes before sun up). While we do our best to not disturb anyone, those who are very light sleepers should be aware.
description.neighborhood: The property is at the back of a quiet residential neighborhood
description.transit: There is a large gravel parking lot to the left of the barn for our guests. Please do not be alarmed if another car or trailer is parked in that space. We will to our best to keep it completely clear while guests are on our property!
description.interaction: We will be on the property in the main residence and are available  by text or in person.
description.house_rules:
Swimming Pool available seasonally with prior arrangements 
No additional guests
