description.summary: Quiet and peaceful. You won’t want to leave this charming, one-of-a-kind place. Close to bike path and metro, easy walking access to restaurants, pharmacy, and stores. Coffee 6 am; light breakfast 7-9 am, check-out 9 am.
description.neighborhood: Quiet neighborhood. Log Cabin Inn is set back with wooded trees all around
description.transit: Parking is available on the street. Metro Access is about one mile walking distance from location. Access subway or bus to downtown DC, historic Old Town Alexandria, Mount Vernon, Reagan National Airport, sporting events. Uber or Lift is used often for rides. Many ethnic restaurants, coffee shops, and pharmacy within walking distance.
description.house_rules: No overnight additional guests unless approved by the owner. No laundry and dishwasher after 10 p.m. Please be considerate of others to keep this home restful and peaceful.

name: Beautifully Designed Spacious Basement Apartment
title: Herndon, Virginia

hosts.about: I’m a software engineer who likes to provide a contactless and high quality self service experience.

description.summary: The space is beautifully designed with a dedicated office, two spacious bedrooms with king and queen size beds, a generously sized living area with sofa and table, a well-equipped kitchen, and a cozy dining room. It is a perfect getaway for entertaining, playing, and working.
description.space:
This 1400sqft living and working space is a dream come true! The living room is perfect for family hangouts and movie nights, while the newly painted air blue office room is ideal for a full day of productive work. The two spacious bedrooms provide a great night of restful sleep. The fully equipped kitchen and refrigerator meets your cooking needs. Additionally, the playing area for darts and changing area for shoes and mirrors make it easy to get ready for work or other occasions. All in all, this space is the perfect place for family, work, and leisure.

Major Amenities:
1. Fully Painted Office Room With High Quality Long Wooden L-Shape Desk, Office Chair, 2K Monitor and a Book Shelf. 
2. Fully Upgraded Living Room with 85 inch 4K Smart TV with Netflix, Hulu and Amazon Prime Video Subscriptions. 
3. Fully Equipped Kitchen With Coffee Machines (Complimentary K-Cup Coffee), Air Fryer, Water Heater, Water Filter, Salt & Pepper and more. Note we don’t provide dishwasher. If you need to use one, please contact me as we do have it on the first floor.
4. Complimentary Osaki massage chair on the first floor. We kindly ask you to use it mindfully, wearing socks, and refraining from use if you're perspiring, to ensure its pristine condition.
description.access: Guests can access the entire basement apartment and the second floor laundry room.
description.notes: We have gone the extra mile to ensure your stay is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible by providing complimentary snacks and K-cup coffee. We are confident that these additional perks will exceed your expectations and ensure your satisfaction with your stay.
description.neighborhood: The house is situation next to the the Folly Lick Branch Trail in Herndon, VA. The trail is located near the Dulles Toll Road, providing easy access to the rest of the area. There are several parks and recreational areas nearby, including Herndon Centennial Golf Course, Runnymeade Park, and Frying Pan Park. The area is also home to several shopping centers, restaurants, and other amenities.
description.transit: Guests can get around home at 1007 Young Ave, Herndon, VA 20170 by walking, biking, or taking public transportation. The closest bus stop is located at the intersection of Young Ave and Ferndale Ave, and the closest Metro station is  the Herndon Metrorail Station that’s just 9 minutes away. Additionally, there are several ride-sharing services available in the area, such as Uber and Lyft.
description.interaction: It’s preferred to interact via texting and app. Feel free to reach out to Co-host for any common questions. Let us know how we can make your experience here better!

name: Palisades Carriage House #peacelove&parking
title: Washington, District of Columbia

gallery.caption: Green couch folds out to a bed (between a twin and full size)
King size bed with blackout curtains
Access the house via the green alley on Dorsett Place.
An extra folding cot (twin), extra linens, iron, and ironing board are available in the upstairs bedroom closet.

hosts.about: Mom to two big dogs and two little humans. Lawyer working in public policy.

recent.comments: Had such a great time here! I scheduled a last minute stay and they were so responsive and accommodating. The house has everything you need which is great. No issues and everything was just as described on the listing. Thank you!

items.comments: Had such a great time here! I scheduled a last minute stay and they were so responsive and accommodating. The house has everything you need which is great. No issues and everything was just as described on the listing. Thank you!

What a gorgeous little hideaway. Perfect for a small family. Place was spotless. Tons of street parking. Private entrance. Updated everything. Close to all the monuments/museums. Great local restaurants. Starbucks around the corner. Beautiful neighborhood. Hosts were accommodating and always responded in a timely manner. I never wanted to leave!!

I cannot say enough good things about this place and family. I spent 6 weeks here with my daughter and felt like I was home the entire time. Jenny and Stephen are wonderful hosts and wonderful people. The place looks exactly as described, it is a very peaceful area but yet lots of restaurants around and close to everything. This place is good for both, families or just couples, everything is new and extremely clean. Jenny and Stephen are very responsive and very proactive to make sure your stay is the best possible experience. I highly recommend this place, this family, this area, just all of it. This place became my home away from home -and will be my choice every time I’m back in DC. Thank you so much again for everything!
This is a wonderful place! Sparking clean, great neighborhood, and great host communication.

Great location if you’re wanting to see the monuments and anything downtown DC. Several restaurants, coffee shops and convenience stores in walking distance. Bike rentals close by. Beautiful walking/biking trails. The house is a good size for 2 adults and 1 kid. The common area is a bit small but if you’re like us, you’ll be out most of the day so it’s not too big of a deal. The hosts were super responsive and there’s even a desk with Ethernet hookup if you have to do some work like I did. Super pet friendly area too!
The place was beautiful, good location and exactly what it looked like online. Our only complaint was that there were no extra pillows and blankets for the extra guests. Otherwise it worked out great
Adorable carriage house, everything brand new. Quiet Palisades location.

description.summary:
Enjoy this newly built D.C. carriage house, its close to everything and in one of D.C.'s nicest neighborhoods, making your visit seamless & fun. We have free and abundant street parking (no hourly limit), a Starbucks, playground, a park and several other restaurants within a short walking distance. 

The Palisades is a quiet, peaceful neighborhood close to downtown D.C. We are located 3 miles from Georgetown, 1.5 miles from American University, and 5 miles from the National Mall/White House.
description.space: The carriage house is located in the backyard of a separate primary residence. Guests do not need to enter the backyard to enter the property. The carriage house can be accessed via a private entrance from the green alley next to the property. The bedroom (king bed and folding twin-size cot), full bath, and washer/dryer are located on the second floor. A pull-out couch, pack and play, kitchen and a powder room are located on the first floor.
description.neighborhood:
According to the Washington Post, the Palisades is "quiet, verdant and close to downtown. Of the many friendly faces you’ll see while strolling around the Palisades neighborhood in Northwest Washington — dog walkers, mail carriers and cyclists — the most charming of them all will be the neighborhood itself. Its woods, paths along the Potomac and houses neatly tucked into nature are pleasantly quiet and a delight to explore. It’s a great place to raise a family."

The private entrance for this house is accessible from the alley closest to the intersection of Dorsett Pl and Galena Pl NW.
description.transit:
The carriage house is located on an alley that is adjacent to free street parking. Driving to the Palisades from Virginia and Maryland is easy, as it is located near major thoroughfares of Canal Rd and Chain Bridge Rd.

Biking is easy with Capital Crescent trail located .5 miles away, the paved trail runs south to Georgetown, north to Bethesda, and connects to the rest of D.C. via bike.
description.interaction:
Owners of the house live in the primary residence (the bigger house) on the property and are available to help with any issues during your stay.

We have a backyard that connects the main house to the carriage house but our two dogs use it frequently so please let us know before using it so we can make sure our dogs are inside (they are old and grumpy).
description.house_rules:
Per DC Code Section 9901.12, "Occupancy in a short-term rental shall be limited to a maximum of eight (8) transient guests, or two (2) guests per bedroom, whichever is greater."

Our carriage house comfortably sleeps 4. For sleeping, there is a king bed, a pull-out couch, a folding cot, and a pack and play crib (by request).

Excellent place

description.summary:
Hello from STAYBNBDC! We are a professional hosting and hospitality management company with a passion for outstanding service.

Shops, cafes, restaurants and METRO only steps away in most desirable neighborhood. Newly renovated, 2-floor cottage oasis complete with lounging and dining areas. Includes FAST Wifi, 42" Roku TV, futon and washer/dryer. Windows surround with plenty of natural light in a lovely, treed backyard.

Free street parking, reserved space in driveway $20/day.
description.space:
We are one of the original Airbnb hosts in D.C.!
If this home is not available for your dates, please check out our similar listings.
description.access: This is a private home with a private entrance.
description.neighborhood: Clarendon is the best neighborhood in the city. The best that Arlington has to offer is right out your front door. Many of the best restaurants in the city are within walking distance, as are coffee shops, nightlife, grocery stores --e everything you need for a getaway in DC. The White House, the Mall, downtown and Georgetown are all within a short distance. The rest of the city is within easy reach with Clarendon Metro Station 1 block away!
description.transit: You are strategically located close to Bikeshare, Metro, and multiple bus routes. Your home is a quick Uber ride to downtown, Convention Center, and Capitol One Arena.
description.interaction: We are happy to share touristic advice and restaurant recommendations. Let us know how we can help make your stay outstanding!
description.house_rules:
Please confirm that you accept the following House Rules and Responsibilities on behalf of yourself and your fellow guests. A violation of the House Rules will result in eviction without a refund.

Unauthorized guests, visitors, or pets are not permitted. Our home is in an extremely quiet and sensitive neighborhood. Any excessive noise or traffic will cause the neighbors to report to the police. The unauthorized visitor/guest fee is $100/person and the pet fee is $250/pet. We observe strict quiet hours from 10:00 pm-8:00 am. Amplified music is not permitted at any time.

Guests that are under 25 years old OR residents of D.C., Maryland, or Virginia need to contact the Host before Instant Booking. 

Some property insurance providers require the Host to collect the name and picture of a government-issued photo ID for each guest. If requested, the Guest agrees to provide this information within three (3) hours of booking confirmation or the reservation will be canceled.

For the comfort of our guests, neighbors, and team members, smoking of any kind (marijuana, cigarettes, or vaping) is not permitted within thirty (30) feet of the property, including outdoor spaces. Should our team or neighbors report the odor of smoke, a $250 fee will be applied.

Our property is booked back-to-back and our cleaning system is a carefully orchestrated process. At select properties, with a day's notice, we can accommodate an early check-in or late checkout of up to three (3) hours for a flat fee paid in advance. Should our home become ready earlier than 4:00 pm, we'll invite you to check in at no extra charge. Standard checkout is 10:00 am and the overstay fee is $100.

Unfortunately, we are not able to offer cancellations, refunds, or rescheduling due to weather or inability to access the property. We are not able to guarantee the possibility of public roads. We do our best to keep driveways and walkways passable, but the guest may be required to shovel the driveway and/or walkways.

The moderate cleaning fee is to sanitize our home. Guests are required to wash/dry/return dishes, collect excess trash, hang wet towels, and return furniture to its original location. Our lovely cleaning staff will do the laundry, wipe down surfaces, vacuum, and make the beds. If our home requires additional cleaning, a supplementary cleaning fee will be collected.

items.comments:
Thanks for the amazing stay! The house is spectacular, spacious, clean and in a great location.

I would come back to stay here any time!

Beautiful house in a quiet and safe neighborhood. Kitchen very well equipped,  amazing and well maintained deck and backyard, spacious living room, 2 large screen TVs with Netflix, and basement with a pool table. My family of 5 including 6, 8 and 17-year olds had more than enough of space. After all day of touring Washington it was great to relax at Laura's place in a peaceful and fully equipped house. Laura is a great host, she gave me detail instructions and was very responsive. I would recommend her place to anyone.
It was a beautiful home. It was definitely the nicest home I have been in this far as an Air B&B. Laura was an awesome host.
Wonderful home well suited to our local needs. Laura is a very responsive host and her house instructions are clear and easy to follow.

Laura is an exceptionally gracious owner who is friendly and responsive. The home is a beautiful mid century architect designed home with manicured lawns and Japanese style garden and gravel. Well located to access Wash DC as well as local attractions. Highly recommended.
GORGEOUS house tucked away in a quiet neighborhood. Perfect for relaxing evenings with family. Lots to do inside on rainy days with an incredibly patient and responsive host!
It was a wonderful and comfortable stay.  Beautifully set home and totally different from other northern Virginia homes.   Enjoyed it very much!

description.summary: This beautiful Mid Century Modern Deck House is close to everything, making it easy to plan your visit. Take a walk to the nearby Central Park,  then grab a coffee downtown McLean or take a 6-8 minute drive to Tysons Shopping Mall. The woods in the back and the vistas within and beyond make this home experience special and spacious. Wildlife like it too!  foxes, squirrels and a wide variety of birds species live right here in the heart of McLean.
description.house_rules:
Welcome to our Deck House!

This is a unique home, and we are delighted to have you here.
The Deck House is a stunning and historic style of architecture. So we can all enjoy a pleasant stay,  go over the following rules. 

- Please be considerate of your neighbors. No loud noises after 10pm. The owners must approve of gatherings with guests not staying in the home. Otherwise, events, gatherings and parties are strictly prohibited. 

- We highly encourage the use of indoor shoes while indoors, especially inside the bedrooms with carpeting.  In addition to that, please refrain from using high heels on the wooden floor, as it is sensitive to damage. 

-Absolutely no smoking  of any kind is allowed inside the house, that includes cigarettes, cigars and vaping.

-Fire hazards: make sure the stove, oven and fireplace are turned off when you leave the premises. Also, do not leave the fireplace on overnight. Avoid burning candles of any kind inside the house.

-Parking is available on the driveway during your stay - not in the garage.  

-When using the bathrooms, avoid flushing excessive amounts of toilet paper. There are trash bins in every bathroom for your convenience.

-If you are staying for an extended period  of time and wish to have cleaning service, contact us through airbnb messaging with a days notice. Charge per extra cleaning is $70.

-When checking out, make sure to take the trash out. There are trash bins located by the garage door where you can place the trash.

If during your stay you have any questions or concerns, please reach out through airbnb messaging. 

We're happy you have decided to book our house. Enjoy!

name: Immaculate Apartment in Downtown Bethesda
title: Bethesda, Maryland

recent.comments: Mark's airbnb and overall hospitality was impeccable and quite possibly the best airbnb experience we've ever had (and I don't say this lightly!). This airbnb was pristine in condition and super clean, extremely cozy, and included all necessary amenities; we instantly felt at home and were grateful to also have such a comfortable bed and dedicated parking space to make driving to NIH much easier for my training. The neighborhood was beautiful and conveniently located near so many highly-rated restaurants, Trader Joe's, and the metro (10 min. walking distance)! Mark was also extremely responsive, highly accommodating, and very friendly. Overall, such a lovely stay at Mark's airbnb and will absolutely be staying here again in the future!

Beautiful neighborhood, centrally located, and easily walkable to restaurants and downtown Bethesda, the metro, and local trails. We would definitely stay here again!

Mark’s stay was perfect for a week long trip to Washington. The rooms were well appointed and it always felt like going “home” at the end of each day. Mark’s local dining recommendations were fabulous, and the house was located only a short walk from the Metro to D.C. He was very accommodating with parking, making it a breeze to come and go by car. I would highly recommend this lovely home for anyone visiting Bethesda or the Washington area.

I loved this place! It was clean, classy, comfortable and convenient.   I appreciate all the fine details the host put into this place.  He was helpful and personable.  I'd definitely recommend.  Five Plus stars!

Perfect location to stay in Bethesda for one person or a couple.  Easy walking distance to restaurants and the metro.  Home is spotlessly clean, has everything needed, and is beautiful inside.  I especially appreciated the parking space and access to laundry.  Highly recommended.

The apartment into the basement area of the home provides privacy  with the outside entry.  The home is very attractive on a beautifully landscaped lot.  The location into the downtown is perfect for walking.  Having a driveway to park our car was a real plus.  Overall it was a nice home like experience for  my wife and I.
There is something sublime about this place, this location: it so wonderfully fulfills a desire for comfort, care, and convenience.

description.summary: Light and bright English basement apartment, nestled in large house on a quiet street, in the heart of downtown Bethesda.  10 minute walk to NIH, Walter Reed, and Bethesda Metro Red Line; steps to restaurants, grocery, bars, fitness, and shops.
description.space:
Enter into newly appointed, well lit, eat-in kitchen with built in table and stools, convection/microwave oven, refrigerator w/ freezer, induction plate, toaster, Keurig coffee maker, French press, basics for cooking and dining.
Bedroom includes queen size bed with new mattress, topper, and bedding, desk, dresser, and large closet, one large window, Roku TV with full cable and WiFi access.  
New renovated bathroom has a large shower with strong water pressure and large granite vanity and new fixtures.
description.access:
Exclusive use of private entrance on left side of house, down short flight of steps.
Guests have immediate access to washer and dryer next to kitchen.
description.notes: Guests will have exclusive use of our driveway for one car.  For additional cars, street parking is available by registration.  I will need license plate number, state, color and make of car.  Parking is restricted from 9 to 5 M-F, free on weekends.
description.neighborhood: Beautiful, safe neighborhood, great for walking and biking... steps from restaurants, Trader Joe's, Harris Teeter, and the Bethesda business district.
description.transit: Easy access to Wisconsin Ave and the Beltway.  Bethesda and Medical Center, Metro are a 10 minute walk, bus routes north and south, 2 blocks.

A complete private entrance, a large fenced yard, a cozy sitting area welcome you home.
The front porch is the perfect place to relax outside.  In the photo are stored ramps for wheel chair access.

Lots of charge in an old world setting

pass through the dining area to the kitchen

There is a "standup" desk with a motor to raise and lower.  Here in the raised position.  There is a wide range of up or down easily controlled by a button on the desk.
Great place for kickball or whatever you imagination can come up with.

recent.comments:
We stayed here for a month in July/Aug 2023. We were 2 adults, a teenager, and our small dog. The space was perfect for what we wanted: a comfortable home, plenty of bedrooms, a big yard for the dog to run around in, and an excellent location in walking distance to Connecticut Ave and its retail establishments near Chevy Chase Circle. The neighborhood was very peaceful and beautiful. There was plenty of space for street parking, a rarity in DC. The beds were all very comfortable. The only drawback was that the home is a duplex, with a unit above ours (as opposed to side-by-side). Over our month visit, there were different guests above us (often with children), which resulted in the fact that we could hear people occasionally stomping or running which was distracting. We were not aware of this setup when we booked. 

Jack was absolutely wonderful to communicate with. He was not only very responsive, but also very friendly. We couldn't have asked for a better host.

And his actual house is l lovely and the bedrooms are more comfortable than we’ve ever experienced. What bedding!! Thank you Jack. You are an absolute gem and so is your lovely house!

We had a great time! The neighborhood is so cute, safe and friendly. The house was extremely clean with great linens and appliances. They really thought of everything with extra outlets next to each bed even! The host was very responsive and made things easy. Overall great stay, we were very happy!

description.summary: Located off Chevy Chase Circle, near bus route, walk to the theater, shopping, restaurants, metro redline at friendship, Lafayette School, Rock Creek parks, and community favorites like Broad Branch Market. This upscale house is a duplex on the Maryland-DC line easy access to Friendship Heights, Bethesda, Silver Spring and Downtown. Visit nearby Rock Creek Golf Course or Horse Center, lots of walking / biking trails, enjoy the serenity of Chevy Chase, the "Beverly Hills" of the east coast :)
description.space: 1920s classic Chevy Chase charm in a Spanish Colonial abode with all the upgrades.  This duplex was build in 1920 and today features a new high end gourmet kitchen, high end washer dryer with folding space hidden behind barn doors, modern furniture mixed with classic antique provide a sophisticated yet family friendly living.  The big high definition 65 in TV above the working fire place invites family and friends to gather.  There are two fenced in yards to choose from - one in the front and another in the rear.  Upscale Chevy Chase is know for luxury and quiet living where old and young mingle together in the quintessential neighborhood.
description.access: In addition to the living space, the property has two large fenced in yards - both are flat and the perfect place to play, entertain or just sit and enjoy the green space.
description.notes: You are close to so many things, easy access to friendship brights, Bethesda, Silver Spring as well as downtown DC.  Nearby and an easy walk is shopping with grocery, restaurants, CVS, theater, library and recreation center.  Nearby schools and playgrounds and the great expanse of Rock Creek Park.  The boutique Broad Branch Market is a neighbor favorite - all that and so much more await at this well situated property.
description.neighborhood: Two blocks from the fountain at Chevy Chase circle - you can't get too much close the Connecticut Avenue than this.  Located at the corner of Western Avenue and Rittenhouse street, it's a prime location with easy access to everything you can think of.
description.transit: Getting around us your choice and you have plenty of options.  Many people enjoy walking the neighborhood or to the nearby shops on Connecticut avenue.  Bike or take the bus, and not far is the red line friendship heights metro.  Many people use their cars and there is plenty of on street parking directly in front of the property - always a space available directly out front or very nearby.
description.interaction: I live a few blocks away in another property and am available if needed.  I give guests their space but jump to it when called on.
description.house_rules: Plenty of free public parking directly in front of the house.  The neighbor in the yellow house next to us requests that we not park in front of his house.  There is not a legal requirement, just to be friendly and cooperative and there is plenty of parking to accommodate his request.

When something minor went wrong, she was very quick to get it fixed. Great place for families, especially since it’s on a quiet street and near a playground, but if you have babies, just be aware there’s stairs up to the second floor and down to the living room.
We had a great stay! The house was perfect for our family and dog. We enjoyed the quick access to the WO&D trail and how quiet the neighborhood was.
Enjoyed our stay and hosts were very responsive! Thanks again!

This is a beautiful house to stay in. It can be a bit noisy at times due to the fact that you’re close to 66, but you also know that going into booking (it’s basically unnoticeable and the house’s exterior and interior makes up for any noise you hear). It’s very accessible to Arlington and D.C. 

I would highly recommend this location to anyone else. The house was also stacked with several extra toiletries such as toothpaste, toothbrush, shampoo, conditioner, and a bunch of towels. 

We consistently felt right at home here!

This place was wonderful. Literally on the W&OD trail, so you could get to the metro crossing only one public road. We had little kids and there were all sorts of parks east on the trail. Somehow feels private when still close proximity to so much in Arlington. Great backyard for our dog. Perfect location to travel east into DC easily or go west to hit wineries/hiking/air and space museum. Probably my favorite air bnb I’ve ever stayed at. Made our trip with little kids in DC a special one!

My family and I enjoyed staying here. The home was bright, spacious, and well-appointed. We particularly appreciated the thoughtful touches, such as the bath robes, sleep masks, and treats.
The hosts were extremely responsive and invested in making sure that we had everything that we needed.

Silvia was absolutely amazing. Upon arriving to the house Silvia had a welcome gift hand picked for my friends and I to enjoy. The house was beautiful, clean and the location was very peaceful (surrounded by trees and beautiful flowers). Each room had it’s own feel but one thing each room had in common was beautiful fluffy queen size beds. Parking was a little different just because the driveway was so steep. But we just parked right in front of the house which was actually better to us. We will definitely stay again when we revisit D.C. The location was perfect not being far from downtown and other areas but also away from all of the busyness and traffic that D.C can bring. Silvia also worked with us concerning our check-out time. Which was very kind seeing that she didn’t have to. Her home is definitely a hidden gem for booking an Airbnb and I strongly recommend if you have a traveling group this house would be a must book. Thanks again Silvia you made this trip one to remember.

description.summary: 10mins to DC! Contemporary colonial home walking distance to metro, shops and restaurants. Enjoy a huge kitchen to prepare family style meals, formal dining room,gracious master suite with spa style bath, wide front porch, wood ceiling family room, work at home center and wrap around decks with BBQ and old fashioned out door bar. Our executive stay home is set up to host weekly and monthly guests, please inquire for other reservation periods. We welcome you to explore everything DC has to offer!
description.space: This home sleeps up to 10 guests with 3 Cal King size beds, and two queen beds. We offer an air bed for a total of 12 guests that can be hosted comfortably. Cozy greeting area and sitting room overlooks the entry way and lush front porch. Three large upstairs bedrooms all with king size beds. Two main level bedrooms with a queen sized bed, one of them adjacent to a full bathroom. Spacious kitchen and entertaining areas, professionally decorated with unique artwork and fully outfitted with all linens & housewares. We welcome you to relax after a long day of sight seeing on the outdoor decks that overlook the bike trails or take a long soak in the master jacuzzi spa to feel refreshed and revived. Furnishings and decor are changed out seasonally and adjusted to each guests needs. Bedrooms can be adjusted to workspaces or studio spaces and the family room can be converted upon request.
description.access: Remote locks and security system are at home entry points, emergency keys are available by contacting the host.
description.notes: The home sits overlooking bike trails and lightly wooded areas, while  maintaining close access to major routes. Some commercial and street noise is noticeable in the backyard and outside rear areas of the home. The owners suite is adjacent to the home with separate entrance/facilities and used occasionally. There are NO shared entrances or spaces. Please contact us with specific dates if this is a concern.
description.neighborhood: Westover is a neighborhood in Arlington, Virginia on the National Register of Historic Places[1] centered on Washington Boulevard between North McKinley Road and North Longfellow Street. A true model of mid-century Urbanism, Westover remains a pedestrian friendly neighborhood which sees its residents walk to shops, work, and public transportation.[2] The neighborhood is between the Ballston Station and the East Falls Church Stations, both part of the Washington DC Metro and is serviced by many Metro Buses.
description.transit: Designated parking in front of the house. There are multiple transportation methods to move around the Washington DC area. The East Falls Church subway in five minutes walking from the house as our busses and shuttles. Uber is widely available as are Lyft and other ride share services. Bicycles can be made available upon request.
description.interaction: We are always available to help you with your stay, offer recommendations for restaurants, sightseeing, travel and getting around the Washington D.C. area.

No pets.

recent.comments: Roger and his listing were great.  Very clean and a great location.

items.comments: Roger and his listing were great.  Very clean and a great location.

Roger was easily reachable, proactive with communication before, during, and after our stay. The pictures matched very well with the online description. The neighborhood felt safe and was easily accessible by Metra (also felt safe here!) and to local restaurants / groceries. Bed was THE most comfortable we’ve ever had (7 yrs of Airbnb travel here) and several extras to boot! Only reason for 4 out of 5 (and would have made it 4.5 if possible) - bathroom could use a little TLC. Maybe add another shelf and reset towel rack for more “space” to set items. Would stay here again!

El lugar en si es súper cómodo para familia!! Estaba súper limpio., disfruté mucho mi estancia !! Puedo recomendarlo 100% solo me gustaría que la comunicación fuera un poquito más rápida ante situaciones de emergencia ., el parking si da un poquito. De estrés . Pero lejos de eso muy agradecida con los anfitriones por su ayuda 👌

This place was excellent. super clean. Nice and quiet. It was very spacious.  It's in a safe and quiet neighborhood, right next to a park if you want to walk. Very close to stores and food shops. One thing important to us was a clean floor and this place had them. Super cute and nice. just a 2 minute walk to the metro rail to DC.  We'd definitely rent this place again if we get back to DC. Roger was great, nice and very responsive to questions.

We enjoyed our stay at Roger's. He was very responsive and everything was clean. Great location close to the Metro, restaurants and stores. Parking was easy and the space was perfect for our family. We would definitely recommend Roger's place to anyone visiting the DC area.

This place was great - quiet, private, very comfortable, and very clean. It was super easy to get off & on I-66. The bed was a little firmer than we like, but the fold-out couch was surprisingly comfortable. The dishwasher was a nice bonus, and if you're traveling with youngsters they have kids' books, games, and a toddler toilet seat. It's a very short walk to East Falls Church Metro (10 minutes is generous, it's more like 5), which would've been really helpful if the Metro weren't down for maintenance on our visit! Benjamin Banneker Park is also right next door, and its playground is really really nice for cooped-up kids. All in all, I think it's a really good deal for the area. Be forewarned that there's a short flight of stairs to get into the basement, so the place isn't wheelchair-accessible and might be difficult to navigate with lots of luggage.

We were in town for a family member's wedding, but wanted to avoid the DC traffic and congestion.  Roger's place was in a quiet neighborhood, yet within walking distance to some great restaurants and the multi-use bike trail.  

The downstairs apartment was well appointed, clean, and nicely decorated.  Roger left us some treats which were appreciated after a long travel day.  Really enjoyed our stay and highly recommend for anyone visiting the DC, Arlington, Falls Church area.

P.S.  The above floors were occupied, but the residents were obviously very conscious of downstairs guests.  We hardly knew they were there.

description.summary:
♢ Only a 4-minute walk to nearest Metro subway station at East Falls Church station (on the ORNG/SLV lines)
♢ 13-minutes by car to Downtown DC
♢ Our street doubles as the Washington & Old Dominion trail, the regional bike/running trail
♢ Roku-enabled HDTVs (Netflix, Amazon Prime, etc.)
♢ FREE High-speed WiFi
♢ FREE Street parking

Come stay in the downstairs 1-BR apartment of this charming East Falls Church bungalow! This place is a great home base for all your planned activities in the DC Metro
description.space:
→ Onsite washer + dryer
→ Fully-stocked kitchen
→ Flexible check-in & check-out upon request

Experience life as a local in the lovely city of Falls Church VA, and truly enjoy your next DC area trip with a stay in this warm and well-located 1-bedroom basement apartment.  Full of character, you'll feel right at home in this comfy cozy space.

A great place to work if you are traveling on business or visiting for pleasure. The great location puts you close to great food, fun and minutes (by foot!) from world-class transportation that can take you all around the city and beyond!  You’ll be located in a quiet residential neighborhood where our guests find it easy to truly unwind by hanging out in the relaxing living spaces after a long day of sightseeing and/or business meetings.  

If you want to stay in and prepare dinner, the kitchen includes every appliance you'll need to do so including dishwasher and oven, and is fully stocked with cookware, dishes, and utensils.

You and your guests will rest in comfort. The bedroom has a King-size bed, and plenty of closet storage space for your personal belongings.  The den has a full-size pullout sofabed.   Additionally, the unit also has a twin-sized air mattress that guests are welcome to use.  For those with young children, we can provide you with a portable crib (by request only).

There is a full bathroom that our cleaners keep impeccably clean, as well as a washer and dryer in the unit for your convenience.  

Enjoy the free high-speed Wi-Fi with which you can stay connected, stream movies, or catch up on some work. The desk that's available is adjustable with the push of a button, and can be converted as desired from a sitting to a standing desk for maximum comfort while you work!

We're looking forward to hosting you soon!!
description.access: Guests will have access to the entire basement/ground level private apartment of this home.
description.neighborhood:
We love our location! Nestled in a quiet neighborhood, yet only a block from a Metro station with DC at your fingertips. Our street doubles as part of the regional bike/running trail network – known as the Washington & Old Dominion trail. We are steps from the newest playground in Arlington. There are local restaurants just down the street that we like to get takeout from (or sit down at, pre-covid): Yayla Bistro (Turkish), and Cote d’Or (French) for special occasions. You can also walk to South Block, a coffee/smoothie shop that is a local DC chain.

In a short 5-minute drive (or 20 minute walk on a nice day), you find yourself in Westover, a beautiful local shopping area in Arlington. Recommend Lost Dog Café or The Italian Store, as well as the Westover Market for necessities and an extensive beer selection. If you find yourself in need of just about anything you can probably find it at Ayer’s Hardware.

In the opposite direction, you are a similar 5-minute drive or 20 minute walk to Falls Church, known as “The Little City” and it has a great community feel. On your way there (walking), stop by Café Kindred for a coffee or brunch. There is a Saturday morning farmer’s market at the town community center. Dine with the locals at Dogwood Tavern or Claire and Don’s Beach Shack, and catch live music at the State Theater next door. Maneki Neko is a great spot for sushi, right on the main street (Broad St/Rt 7), and Northside Social is another option for a caffeinated drink and brunch.

Of course, all of these attractions are a short walk or drive from the apartment. A short drive or metro ride puts you right in the center of all the DC area has to offer.
description.transit:
East Falls Church Metro subway station is only a block away – from there it is a 24-minute ride (no transfers!) to the Smithsonian stop (National Mall, museums). 

Bike share is available at the Metro station. 

Uber and Lyft are always readily available. We are one block from the entrance to I-66, a short 10-minute drive to the DC line.
description.interaction: While we offer contact-less self-check in for your convenience, we are always only a message away should you need anything at all during your stay.
description.house_rules:
Please be courteous to the adjacent neighbors and the tenants living around you at ALL times by keeping noise volumes to a reasonable level. From 10 PM - 8 AM please adhere to very strict quiet hours when noise is to be kept at an absolute minimum.
Please do NOT flush anything other than toilet paper. No feminine products, baby wipes, contraceptives, nor paper towels should be flushed at anytime. If it is found that any of these items have been flushed and clog the septic system you could be held responsible for the cost of repair.
ABSOLUTELY NO Smoking or Vaping of any kind inside the apartment; young children live upstairs.
ABSOLUTELY NO Parties or Events.

hosts.about: Avid skier, sailor, surfer... I love to travel. I also love hosting in my own places.  I have 13 and counting.

recent.comments: We really enjoyed our stay at Cam’s place.  The communication was A+, the place was clean and had everything we needed. Plenty of space and a serene setting. Wonderful outdoor spaces, deck, yard, etc.   We felt right at home. Highly recommend!

items.comments: We really enjoyed our stay at Cam’s place.  The communication was A+, the place was clean and had everything we needed. Plenty of space and a serene setting. Wonderful outdoor spaces, deck, yard, etc.   We felt right at home. Highly recommend!

A great home convenient to DC. An amazing secluded woodland property. House is rustic with some wonderful features like a spacious dining room surrounded by windows overlooking the woods. Great for our family gathering. Cameron was very responsive and helpful.

The location of the house was great, just a quick drive in to DC to see all the sights. House was rustic but clean with modern kitchen appliances. Driveway is over a narrow bridge and then very steep- in the event of snow or ice I imagine it would be difficult to traverse. If traveling with kids, bring games, books, activities as there is nothing besides the TV to keep them entertained in your downtime. Overall, good spot to stay and could be great with some TLC and attention to detail.
We had a wonderful stay here! Great house and location- would highly recommend.

You will not be disappointed with this. House is amazing. Being close to DC but out far enough to relax from all the hustle and bustle. Our family absolutely loved the property and it’s surroundings. Getting to the metro and taking it in to DC was close too. Our host was super easy to work with and communicate with. If you’re looking for a place to stay outside of DC this is it.

This comfortable home feels like a quiet woodland retreat, yet you're just a few minutes away from the center of McLean, the DC Beltway, Tysons Corner and Georgetown. Our group of friends enjoyed gathering around the wood-burning fireplaces in the living room and dining room. The well-stocked kitchen, Netflix and comfortable beds made for a relaxing escape. Cameron provided lots of information and responded very quickly to questions.

We very much enjoyed our stay at Cameron's home. Cam was a wonderful host. He left us well stocked with wood pellets and firewood, and called on the first day to make sure we knew how to run the pellet stove (pro tip: don't leave the lid open longer than 60 seconds). His home is really well situated. It's minutes from the GW Parkway, I-495, and Mclean proper, making it convenient to get places. Even with that, it's very quiet/private: your only visitors will be foxes and roving mobs of deer who are wholly unafraid of you. There are some beautiful views from the giant windows all over the house. 

The flip side to those giant windows is that it can get a little nippy when it's cold but that's where the fireplace and stove come in. All in all, this is a wonderful home for a family or private getaway. Five stars.

Welcome to our spacious and inviting 3-bed, 2-bath Airbnb in Fairfax! Unwind in the cozy living room, cook up meals in the well-equipped kitchen, and enjoy the basement entertainment area. Outside, the deck with dining and a fire pit beckons. Explore Fairfax Old Town Hall (8 mins), George Mason University (4 mins), Tysons Corner (18 mins), and Washington DC (35 mins). 
With great amenities and a prime location, our Airbnb is the perfect choice for your stay.
description.space: The space you are referring to is a property that consists of two rooms with queen beds, accommodating a total of four people. Additionally, there is another room with a bunk bed, suitable for two people. In total, the property can comfortably accommodate six guests. Furthermore, there is a couch in the common area that can be converted into a bed, providing sleeping space for one more person if needed.
description.access: Keypad on the door.
description.neighborhood:
Welcome to our charming neighborhood in Fairfax, Virginia! Nestled on Andes Drive, our delightful Airbnb offers a cozy retreat for your stay in the vibrant and historic city of Fairfax. With its convenient location and a plethora of attractions nearby, you'll find yourself immersed in a perfect blend of tranquility and urban excitement.

Prime Location:
Our neighborhood is situated in a quiet residential area, providing a peaceful ambiance for a relaxing getaway. Despite the serene surroundings, you'll be delighted to discover that the bustling heart of Fairfax is just a short distance away. Whether you're here for business or leisure, our location offers easy access to major highways, public transportation, shopping centers, and renowned dining establishments.

Cultural Enrichment:
Fairfax boasts a rich history and diverse cultural scene. Immerse yourself in the local heritage by visiting the historic sites and landmarks, including the Fairfax Court House and the Civil War Interpretive Center. Nearby, you'll find the George Mason University campus, where you can catch performances at the Center for the Arts or explore the fascinating exhibits at the Mason Libraries.

Outdoor Recreation:
Nature enthusiasts will be thrilled to know that our neighborhood is surrounded by picturesque parks and green spaces. The neighboring Fairfax County Government Center Park offers beautiful trails for walking, jogging, or cycling. Enjoy a picnic under the shade of towering trees, play a game of Frisbee on the open lawns, or simply unwind while soaking up the peaceful atmosphere.

Shopping and Dining:
For those seeking a bit of retail therapy, you'll be pleased to find numerous shopping destinations within easy reach. The vibrant Fair Oaks Mall, Fair City Mall, and Fairfax Corner boast an array of shops, boutiques, and specialty stores, offering something for everyone. Indulge your taste buds at the diverse range of restaurants, cafes, and eateries nearby, where you can savor both local and international flavors.

Family-Friendly Attractions:
Families will find plenty of entertainment options to keep everyone entertained. Visit the nearby Children's Science Center to spark curiosity and creativity in young minds, or spend a day at the delightful Frying Pan Farm Park, where kids can interact with farm animals and enjoy exciting activities. For thrill-seekers, the nearby Go Ape Treetop Adventure Course offers an exhilarating outdoor experience.

Proximity to Washington, D.C.:
Our neighborhood serves as an excellent base for exploring the nation's capital. Hop on the nearby Metro or take a short drive to Washington, D.C., and discover iconic landmarks such as the White House, National Mall, and Smithsonian museums. After a day of sightseeing, return to our cozy retreat and unwind in comfort.

We can't wait to welcome you to our neighborhood and provide a memorable experience during your stay in Fairfax. Book your stay with us today and embark on an unforgettable journey filled with history, culture, and relaxation.

Great place in a perfect location for my visit! Will definitely stay here again.

We were quite happy with our stay at Damien's place. We were in town visiting family nearby and needed a place to stay for 2 weeks, so we appreciated having a fully functional kitchen to make meals and a private space. Check-in and check-out was very easy and Damien was quite responsive to any questions we had by message. We met on one occasion and he was also very friendly. As other reviews mentioned, the house was a bit dusty and we felt the need to clean a bit before using things in the kitchen, but it wasn't as bad as some other reviews seemed to suggest. Nothing shocking. Comfortable bed, nice shower. Overall, I would recommend Damien's place if you're looking for something in this area.

This is a lovely little home with nice furnishings. Damien is very responsive and helpful.

hosts.about:
I love life and see all challenges as opportunities. 
 After raising three daughters, I have developed a deep desire to form relationships with people from around the world. Since, I have traveled to places where I have been hosted by locals and that made it personal and authentic.That kind of travel introduced me to places and sites tourist do not get to see and this deepened my understanding of every culture I have been introduced to. And so I felt it is time to return some of that favor by sharing my space with those who are exploring the area where I live and offer them a home away from home and be hospitable and available to make the experience authentic and memorable. 
I love to travel, read and engage in meaningful and purposeful relational work that might impact our world for the better. I love my morning coffee, my walks in the park, and for sure my ethnic Lebanese food. My home is my sanctuary  of rest and rejuvenation and my garden is where I get the closest to meditation and reflection. And most of all, I love to spend time with my granddaughter.
Welcome ! I am happy to share.

recent.comments: Very nice basement apartment with a lovely garden. Location is perfect, close to DC and Arlington downtown. Taking Uber was very easy and economical. We did experience an act of nature on this trip, large storm took out electricity for a couple days, but the apartment stayed cool during this hot summer! No biggie for us, as we enjoyed the nature trail right across from the house and the garden. Loved the garden! The furniture and kitchen are not fancy, but it works perfect for anyone coming to the area to see the local attractions.

Best,

name: The Crooked Camel
title: Barnesville, Maryland

hosts.about: Taking care of my mom's house now after half a life of adventure inside and outside the US.  Looking forward to hosting your stay!

recent.comments: Personne ultra serviable, merci!

items.comments: Personne ultra serviable, merci!

This is a beautiful home in a secluded setting.  The host, Richard, is extremely gracious and friendly and accommodated all our needs during check-in.  Things to be aware of:  a cat does live in the house.  Also, is located in quite a rural setting not near anything.  Finally, the host lives on the same property in a separate house behind the house that we stayed in, which may be a consideration if you are looking for absolute privacy.  All in all, it was a great find.
Rare and interesting place in a beautiful setting. Richard was a generous and available host. We loved our stay. Would recommend to anyone.

The place was beautiful with tons of really cool pieces of art throughout. Richard was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Beds were comfy and the grounds were picturesque. Multiple nice sitting areas inside and out. We had a soccer tournament at the Maryland Soccerplex in Boyds, just 15 minutes away. Think we had the most convenient place to stay of all on our team.

This is such a sweet find. Probably the most amazing place I’ve found. Host went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The house and grounds are so beautiful. It has a delightful kitchen and the sun room was so fun for morning coffee time. He even welcomed BSU’s women’s rugby team between tournament games. Max you truly are awesome, we will be repeat customers!

description.summary: Century-old country house in Maryland near the DC metro area.  Come relax or enjoy local adventures!  Easy access to great cycling, boating, hiking, wineries, and nature.  The house is furnished with interesting decor from 30 years spent overseas.  3 rooms available, with a total of 4 beds, and two bathrooms.  Nearby train line, visitors should expect to hear passing trains.  Manager lives on-property in a separate building.  Must be feline friendly, cat in residence!
description.space: This is an old house, built at the beginning of the 20th century.  Expect an antique and rustic feel.  The owner of the house spent her career overseas, and lots of the stuff in the house is from all over the world.  We are about 100 yards from the historic Barnesville train station, with MARC train service to D.C., so please expect to hear the rumble of trains from time to time (we don't even hear it, but newcomers say it's loud!).
description.access: You are welcome to go anywhere in the house, except for one storage room.  The property is on 3 acres, with one other building where the bnb manager lives.  Feel free to wander around and enjoy the yard and porch and deck.
description.notes: You must be cat friendly!  A cat named Rory is in residence, she will be polite to you and probably ask you to let her in or out, depending on her mood.  I usually come into the house early in the mornings to feed her, so please don't let that surprise you.  Also of note, our house is walking distance from the MARC train, so commuters from DC could come without a car.  The nearby train line does have traffic during the day and night, so don't be surprised when you hear it!
description.neighborhood: Quiet Barnesville, Maryland is a small town in what is left of Montgomery County's rural countryside, near Sugarloaf Mountain.  Our house is on the outskirts of the town, right next to the rural train station, with weekday train access to Washington, D.C.
description.transit: There is one carport and ample parking for 2 or  more vehicles along the driveway.   The house is on MD route 109, a rural road.
description.interaction: I live in a small house up the hill, and will be around for most of your stay.  I'll hope to meet you and make your acquaintance at some point!  And please be amenable to the house's true owner, Rory the Cat, who tends to wander at will.
description.house_rules: Enjoy the house and garden, but make sure to leave things as you found them!  This includes use of the kitchen and other amenities.  A cat named Rory lives in the house and will probably ask you to let her in or out, feel free to comply with her wishes!

We had a great time here. It was a good space and location, close to a lot of things but also a quiet neighborhood which is a hard combo to find in this area. Our dog loved the yard and made a new friend as well!

We had a short stay of 2 days and we felt safe at this Airbnb. The neighborhood is quiet and walkable. A lot of restaurants around and good food. The bed is very comfy and the Expresso machine and the back yard is a big plus for the morning. Because the house is pet friendly we found dog hair on the clothes after the first night's sleep and the host changed the blanket. We didn't find everything that is in the description ( shampoo, body soup, we're empty).
I recommend the house if you want a safe neighborhood and a short drive to Washington DC.

The place looked exactly like the pictures and parking and check in were easy.. The bed was soft.  There was plenty of hot water and towels.  It was very spacious for 2 people. The location was perfect for us.  There are 2 grocery stores and lots of restaurants a few minutes away. The access to downtown was great. We drove to and parked at the West Falls Church metro parking lot and took the subway right to the L'Enfant Plaza stop for the Smithsonian Air & Space museum. Lastly,Julia is a great communicator.  Every time I made a request, she replied very quickly to resolve.  One item to note that the thermostat is upstairs. There is a radiator and Julia's was open to temperature requests.  The price is reasonable for the area.  We had a great weekend.
Clean space, close to D.C., and in a nice neighborhood. Friendly hosts as well, and their dog was awesome.

Everything was smooth and easy, would definitely recommend!!

This place feels like a home away from home.   Very clean and cozy!   We truly enjoyed our stays while attending the conference in DC.   Having a metro nearby is a big bonus for us to avoid driving to DC!   We love the area so much!   Definitely will come back again.
great place to stay and very clean and cosy, would stay here again and recommend to others

This is an amazing little gem in a bustling city area. The cottage was cozy and comfortable, and there were many small touches that made it feel like home, and it was conveniently located. Judith, the host, was very responsive and helpful prior, during, and after our stay. I would definitely stay here again next time I come to the area.

The Middleton Cottage was perfect for our stay in the DC area!  Easy walk to the Metro and to Trader Joes to stock up on provisions.  The Cottage itself is very cute and well appointed.  During our stay, the person renting the main home on the property was very friendly and helpful with all sorts of suggestions on what we could do.  If only we had more time there to take advantage of all the wonderful suggestions!  And, this may seem like a silly thing to some, but as someone with allergies to various things, I really appreciate that highly fragranced products were not used on the bed linens or in the bathroom products.  Thank you ever so much, Judith, and I hope we can someday return to your lovely cottage!
Perfect cabin in the heart of Bethesda! Will def come back. Thanks

description.summary:
Our newly updated charming guest cottage is nestled on a tree-lined residential street in the heart of Bethesda, just two blocks from the Bethesda Metro stop.  A vast array of restaurants, clubs, shops, farmer's markets, bike trails, theaters, galleries, parks and more are a quick walk from our front gate.  

Guests enjoy relaxing in the backyard (which is shared with residents of the main house) and dinning on the patio.

Self check-in is easy with a keypad.
description.space: The bathroom has a stall shower and is stocked with shampoo, conditioner, hair dryer and lots of extras.  The bed is queen-sized and very comfortable with extra pillows and blankets. The updated kitchenette has a brand new full size refrigerator with freezer,  an electric 3 burner cooktop and  a microwave above with outside ventilation. description.house_rules:
We welcome all travelers into our home. House rules are set in place for the comfort and safety of both the guest and the host. By confirming this booking, guests agree to abide by the following: 

1. No parties or events allowed. 

2. No smoking allowed. A fine of $350 will be applied if smoking occurs in the home. 

3. No unregistered guests allowed. You are welcome to bring friends and family as long a list of names, and visiting dates are provided to the host. 

4. Please respect the noise curfew beginning at 10 PM. No loud music or elevated voices allowed. 

5. No illegal substances allowed on the premises. Immediate removal from the home will be requested if any laws are broken.

6. Any lost keys, or parking permits will result in a fee of $250 per item.

description.summary: Located off Chevy Chase Circle, near bus route, walk to the theater, shopping, restaurants, metro redline at friendship, Lafayette School, Rock Creek parks, and community favorites like Broad Branch Market. This upscale house is a duplex on the Maryland-DC line easy access to Friendship Heights, Bethesda, Silver Spring and Downtown. Visit nearby Rock Creek Golf Course or Horse Center, lots of walking / biking trails, enjoy the serenity of Chevy Chase, the "Beverly Hills" of the east coast :)
description.space:
1920s classic Chevy Chase charm in a Spanish Colonial abode with all the upgrades.  This duplex was build in 1920 and today features a new high end gourmet kitchen, high end washer dryer with folding space hidden behind barn doors, modern furniture mixed with classic antique provide a sophisticated yet family friendly living.  The big high definition 65 in TV above the working fire place invites family and friends to gather.  There are two fenced in yards to choose from - one in the front and another in the rear.  Upscale Chevy Chase is know for luxury and quiet living where old and young mingle together in the quintessential neighborhood.

Recently renovated to include new upgraded laundry with high end appliances and a folding table.  A new 4th bedroom is very chic in the upper level loft area includes two balcony skylights, offering a private yet commanding view of old Chevy Chase.  Also in the loft are two office spaces with standing desks and an extra place to relax and enjoy.   The loft is access via a circular staircase adding a touch of whimsy and loft windows cast light into both floors of the space.  Keeping with ne updated feel, a barn door opens to the bath.

The kitchen has a new Viking refrigerator and everything you need to prepare a gourmet meal and serve in the dining room with a table and chairs for eight.
description.access: You have the entire 2nd and 3rd floor (the loft) of of this old world duplex.  Originally built in 1920, you each of the two units has its own separate entrance and the concrete and tile construction means lots of privacy..  Enjoy three private deck/porches and the view from the top of this classic Spanish colonial.
description.notes: Relax and enjoy.  This is a place where families come to live the upscale life in the ultra secure Chevy Chase community nearby downtown.

description.house_rules:
Check in: after 4PM Eastern Time.
Check out: before 11AM Eastern Time. 

**We do have surveillance cameras in both the front and rear of the house that are operating at all times in order to protect our guests and our property. **

- Absolutely No smoking/vaping on the property, including both back yard & front yard of the house. Any violation will result in early termination of entire booking (nonrefundable) and a fine of $1000. This is our home and we have family members who suffer serious respiratory problems. 

- No hair coloring/dyeing of any kind.

- No parties and  No events. No pets please. 

- All visitors need advance permission from your host.

- No more than 12 people ( adults and children) in the house at any given time. 

- More people stay than actually booked are not allowed. 

** Any violation of the house rules mentioned above will result in an Early Termination of the Entire Booking (NONREFUNDABLE) and a fine of $1000.
All guests will be asked to leave the property immediately.

- Please do not wear your shoes inside 
   the house.

- Please turn off all lights & TV when you are not at home.

- Quiet time 10pm~7am. Please respect the fact that this is a very quiet residential neighborhood.

hosts.about:

description.summary:
Gorgeous, private home in the rolling countryside of Leesburg, Virginia.  Enjoy the peace & quiet while still being near all the conveniences & fun of historic Leesburg.  Within 30 miles of DC & 15 miles from the Fairfax area.  Close by is the hunt & wine country of Loudoun Co. Several wineries are within 2 miles of our home!

This 5 bedroom, 4 bathroom home on 3 wooded acres is very spacious & inviting.  With a very open floor plan, enjoy preparing meals while overseeing the Family room fun!
description.space:
Brand new listing!!! 

This ‘home away from home’ is perfect for business or play!  So close to the DC metropolitan area (Ashburn, Fairfax, South Riding, Aldie and Maryland). Relax and enjoy the famous wine/hunt country of Middleburg/Western Loudoun County.   Bring the family or business associates.  

Nestled in an elite neighborhood of 3 to 100 acre wooded estates. (This area is home to multiple Redskin players and staff, including Quarterbacks and Head Coaches!) Enjoy the solitude while still having close by conveniences.  

Entering this home, you are greeted by a two-story foyer and massive brass chandelier reminiscent of the colonial heritage of Virginia and in keeping with the grand estates of the area.   Hardwoods and custom tile throughout this spacious home.

5 cozy Bedrooms and 4 Full Bathrooms on two levels. Soaring, two-story Family room is open to the Gourmet, well-appointed Stainless steel/Granite Kitchen.  The Kitchen has everything that you will ever need to prepare full meals or midnight snacks. 

Formal living room, large Office, Sun room/ Fun room is set up for children’s enjoyment and a large dining room awaits large gatherings or a quiet space for homework or studies.  Laundry room is also available for your use. (Fireplace is currently unavailable for use).

This home's master bedroom is fit for a King with a super comfortable king-size bed. There is a TV and a roomy sitting area.  The master bathroom includes double sinks, Jacuzzi tub and separate shower and water closet.  Three more bedrooms are upstairs with two additional full bathrooms. On the first level, there is a Guest room which also has a library and a children's table.  This room will also keep the little ones content with fun games and toys!  There is a full bathroom/powder room on the first floor complete with a shower.

Outside this exquisite home are opulent landscapes!  Enjoy the water fountain, stone bridge and dry riverbed while sipping your morning coffee on the patio.  To the rear of this home is another stone patio with a large dining area and a gas grill. 

Children will enjoy playing in this natural setting!  Full-size play set includes swings, rock wall, trampoline and tree house (play at your own risk).   Jogs and bike rides are specially fun with this home being in a neighborhood of 24 houses and only conscientious neighbors driving by.  Long, spacious driveway allows lots of parking or playing. 

High-speed Verizon Fios Internet and Keyless entry are highlights of this extremely high-tech home fully equipped for your business and personal needs!  We have excellent internet here.  (Be careful when booking other houses in the area, if they don't have FIOS and internet speed is important, you might be disappointed.)

We recently installed a whole house Ultraviolet light air purification system to kill viruses, bacteria, mold, germs and fungi!  We eliminated all wall-to-wall carpeting as well to help reduce allergens.  Rest assured that we are doing all we can to offer you the cleanest/healthiest rental experience possible!

Basement level (additional fee) which includes a pool table, Foos ball machine, elliptical exercise machine, exercise bands, bathroom and living area with couch and TV is available for an additional fee. Please ask about rate to use this level!  Basement Not included in rate!!!   

Pet are welcome for a fee of $250/per pet+ (price varies depending on length of stay, number of pets, size and breed).

Gatherings MUST be approved by owner in advance.

Available short or long term, this home is sure to please!!!
(3 Day minimum stay)

Thanks for looking and have a blessed day!

description.neighborhood:
Our home is in a delightfully rural, wooded neighborhood. There are gorgeous long trails through the woods that go for miles of unspoiled nature. Meander through woods, along streams all without leaving our neighborhood!

There are many wineries within 5 miles of our home! Two wineries/breweries are within 2 miles, Quattro Goomba and Fleetwood Winery. See our Guidebook for more information on restaurants, activities and sightseeing near by!!!

We really loved Cam's place.  it's got everything we needed and wanted.  Great location and well appointed.  We would definitely stay again next time we're in the area.  Cam was very responsive and flexible with us, too.

The apartment was perfect for our needs. It was open & had space to spread out. The showers were hot & had great pressure, kitchen was well appointed and the beds rooms spacious. The door was a challenge to lock and the parking perfect for one car but tight for two. Otherwise, it was a great place to stay !

We decided to visit our daughter for the weekend, could not have picked a  wetter place, beautiful neighborhood, walkable to amenities.  Very well kept and fully updated and very spacious.  All of the instructions were very clear and well communicated, would stay again next time we visit the DC metro area.

NO PARTIES - This is not a party house.  The Renter must be 25 years of age to book this Vacation Rental.  Any special occasions such as weddings, receptions, family reunions or an increase of occupants (guests not registered on registration form) must be disclosed at the time the reservation is made and is subject to Owner's advanced approval. Prom parties, fraternity or sorority parties, and graduation parties are not allowed at any time.  Adults cannot rent property on behalf of underage guests, no exception.

This is a 'vacation and Corporate Executive' home only and it is strictly forbidden to use it as a loud music, drinking, party house. Unreasonable (55db or more) noise in the courtyard or home at any time will result in either the police being called or neighbors calling the owner.  This property is located in residential neighborhood. MD just passed a law that makes it unlawful "for a person to make a loud noise that is likely to annoy or disturb one or more persons in their building or neighborhood." Police may arrest violators on site, using handcuffs and other measures. Violators will face misdemeanor charges, a $500 fine and up to 90 days in jail. 

Please note that due to the fact that sleeping preferences of individuals are different, we will never presume to inform our clients if the number of guests they have in their party will fit our unit sizes. We merely provide our clients with the sq.ft of the unit, number of beds available in each unit, number of bathrooms, and pictures of the unit. It is our guests' responsibility to determine if our unit is suitable to their preferences and if the unit is adequate for their number of guests. The maximum number of guests mentioned in our ad is based on the past guests stay and it is not indicative of individual preferences. We do offer additional units in the same building in case you require more space for your party as well.

Licensees understand that Licensor offers travel insurance for their protection and that Licensor strongly encourages Licensees to either acquire Licensor’s policy or Licensees own policy to protect their vacation investment against unforeseen events.  The cost of Licensor’s travel insurance is 7% of the total rent or 11.5% if the premium "Cancel For Any Reason" policy is selected and is non-refundable.
Under no circumstances will Tenants or their guests hold the Owners of the Vacation Rental responsible for any damages or claims of any kind resulting from their stay, except for intentional acts of harm.

recent.comments:
Nearly all my interaction was with the co-host Daphne as opposed to the host. She was very nice and greeted me upon arrival. Everything was as described. There was a small issue with the HVAC but she had it sorted out immediately. People should note that the beds, particularly the master, are very firm. Didn’t bother me, but I can see how plush lovers not care for them. And while we didn’t use it, it was a nice surprise to see that they had an extra double bed for us to use.
Gorgeous, walkable neighborhood. I brought a classic car that I wanted off street, so the driveway access was handy. The metro is a 15-20 minute walk, but you always feel safe, and there are some pretty sights on the way.

Overall it was very clean and accommodating. Would definitely stay here again.

description.summary: A neat house, located in a convenient area, to stay when your family tour Washington DC area. Walk to metro stations, bus stop, grocery shops, restaurants, and shopping strips.
description.space: This townhouse is attached to a main house on a fenced property. It is located in Chevy Chase West, across Wisconsin Ave from a golf course.
description.access: The guests enter the townhouse through a private entry door to the two level townhouse.  We apologize for no wheel chair access .
description.neighborhood:
The property is located in an upscaled residential area yet within walking distance to Red Line metro stations (one stop from Bethesda to NIH and Nava Hospital), bus stops, grocery shops (Giants, Safeway, Trader Joe's, Whole foods, Amazon Fresh, Target, CVS), shopping strips (Bethesda Row, Friendship Heights), and more than 200 restaurants. Play ground, tennis courts, baseball field, and soccer field are in a nearby Norwood Park. Capital crescent trail leads from Bethesda to Georgetown.
The Smithsonian is home to 21 museums and the National Zoo. Be prepared to spend at least a week to visit all of them. It is also recommended to visit The United States Capitol. 
There are two sites that exhibit cherry flowers at end of March and early April. Kenwood is only one mile away. Take Wisconsin Ave south, turn right at Dorset Ave, cross Little Falls Parkway. Kenwood is ahead. Tidal Basin in Downtown DC is another location to view the cherry flowers. Take Metro from Friendship Heights toward Wheaton-Glenmont, at Metro Center station transfer to Blue line toward Largo, get off at Smithsonian station, follow the crowds and enjoy the rest of day taking thousands of photos.
The U.S. Naval Academy in Annapolis is another place to visit (40 Miles). In Annapolis, enjoy the seafoods during crab season.
Luray Cavern is approximately 100 miles away. Spend at least 4 hours to view the massive underground lair with 140-ft. natural columns, and colorful stalactites.
description.transit: This townhouse is one block from bus stops, walking distance to Bethesda and Friendship Heights metro stations (one stop from Bethesda to NIH and Nava Hospital) to DCA and IAD airports. Parking is at private driveway, off street parking is also available.
description.interaction: We (my assistant and I) are available when needed.

hosts.about:
My family and I live in a wonderful neighborhood called the Palisades in Washington DC.

We collectively speak English, Dutch, German and Spanish, and would like to keep improving our French, Italian and Portuguese.

Our passions are art & dance, skiing, wine, books and sharing great meals with kind people who also appreciate traveling and the world’s cultures.

You'll see in my reviews that I started hosting a while ago from our homes in DC and then in a boutique hotel group I created in Cuba. 

Happy to be back hosting after taking a break and offering you a nice place to stay here in the nation's capital.

recent.comments: Great location, loved the adjacent trails! Enjoyed our stay.

items.comments: Great location, loved the adjacent trails! Enjoyed our stay.

A great gem in a beautiful neighborhood just outside of downtown DC. A 20 minute ride into town. Nice restaurants close by. Very clean, great artwork, nicely designed home. The beds were very comfy, sheets felt great, nice towels & linens. 

A great host. Very kind, and very responsive. Thought of every detail you could possibly want or need. Highly recommend!
Kevin’s place was convenient and lovely and Kevin himself is super accommodating and helpful. We would totally stay here again.

We stayed a couple of days and the house has everything we needed. Kitchen and bathrooms were well furnished, and Kevin provided us a travel cot bed and a high chair for my little one. 
Thank you

My sisters and I used the place for our reunions and everything was perfect; clean, comfortable, and stocked with everything we could need. Quiet neighborhood but easy to get everywhere. We will stay again!

The place was perfect…  Beds were extremely comfortable!  Kevin’s very nice, checked in occasionally to see if we needed anything.  Place was stocked with all needs including coffee!  Great back yard, (hope we weren’t too loud).  Still trying to figure out what’s the deal with the shower downstairs?

Kevin was responsive, helpful and very kind. Everything was as advertised and we only wish we could’ve stayed longer. We will definitely recommend Kevin again and hopefully, will be able to come sometime in the future. You can’t go wrong.

description.summary:
Enjoy family & close friends at this stylishly renovated home. Located in the beautiful wooded Palisades-- it has parking, is within 10 minutes of Georgetown and downtown DC and is central to everything in the Washington Metropolitan Area. 
The neighborhood has many exceptional restaurants in walking distance, tennis & pickleball courts and beautiful trails. The house has a charming shared front porch and backyard for relaxing. Our family lives in the other half of the duplex.
description.interaction: We're fun and social, and usually busy with work, projects, family and friends. Happy to host (as we have been for many years), ensuring you have a comfortable stay.

I know what we want as guests and I want to be a better host for it. We do not smoke or drink. We would love it if our guests would take care of our property as we take care of others'.

Our home and neighborhood bore the brunt of the storm that passed through NoVA and the DC area over the weekend. We were looking for a temporary place to stay nearby while power lines were being repaired and tree debris/damage were being cleaned from our house.  When we saw Mike's place as available, we immediately reached out and Mike was responsive  reassuring, and supportive amid a very stressful time for our family. The house is amazing - lots of space, well decorated, clean, great location - our three year old loved the "new house". Extra bonus for it being next door to Heidelberg pasty shoppe and closely located to other neighborhood favorites like Modo Mio and Peter Chang's. We felt right at home! We appreciated Mike's communication and support. We will certainly keep his place in mind next time we have family visiting from out of town.
