name: Grand House steps to high end Bethesda Row & Metro
title: Chevy Chase, Maryland

description.summary:
Welcome to our exceptional property, ideally located in the heart of Bethesda, MD. A mere stroll away from the vibrant Bethesda Row, where you'll find an array of upscale shops, diverse dining options, a movie cinema, and convenient access to the metro!

Our inviting home offers the perfect fusion of comfort, style, and convenience, accommodating 8-10 guests. It's the ideal choice for families, friends, or business travelers seeking an unforgettable stay in a prime location.
description.space:
Our home is thoughtfully designed to provide comfort and convenience for our guests, with room-by-room information as follows: The house is designed and furnished to accommodate 8 Adults. 

Upstairs Bedroom 1: Retreat to the spacious upstairs master bedroom, featuring a plush king bed offering tranquility and comfort.

Upstairs Bedroom 2: Adjacent to the master suite, there is another bedroom with a queen bed. It provides a cozy and restful space for our guests.

Main Floor Bedroom 3: On the main floor, there is another master with a comfortable king bed. This convenient setup allows for easy accessibility.

Main Floor: The main floor features the fully equipped kitchen, where you can prepare delicious meals using locally sourced ingredients. The lounge area is perfect for relaxation and socializing, with comfortable seating and a warm ambiance. The dining room provides ample seating for all guests, making it ideal for shared meals, games, or planning your day's adventures. Additionally, there is a convenient half bathroom on this level.

Basement: The open concept basement offers versatility and additional space for your enjoyment. It includes a lounge area where you can unwind and relax. The basement also features a full bathroom, providing convenience for guests. In this area, you'll find two full beds, offering flexible sleeping arrangements.

Step outside to our beautiful backyard, a serene oasis where you can enjoy your morning coffee or spend a peaceful evening under the stars.

We want your stay to be as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. If you have any questions or need assistance, please don't hesitate to reach out.
description.access: Guests will have exclusive access to the entire house during their stay. This includes all three bedrooms, two and a half bathrooms, the fully equipped kitchen, the comfortable living area, the dining area, the spacious basement, the beautiful backyard, and parking space for 2-3 cars. We want you to feel at home and have the freedom to enjoy all the amenities and spaces our house has to offer.
description.neighborhood:
Bethesda Row is a vibrant and upscale neighborhood located in the heart of Bethesda, Maryland. Known for its charming streets lined with stylish boutiques, high-end shops, and a diverse range of dining options, this neighborhood offers a unique shopping and dining experience.

Stroll along Bethesda Avenue and discover an array of fashion-forward clothing stores, luxury brands, and specialty shops. From designer labels to unique local boutiques, Bethesda Row caters to every fashion taste and style.

When it comes to dining, Bethesda Row leaves no culinary desire unmet. Indulge in a wide variety of cuisines, from internationally-inspired fine dining establishments to trendy cafes, lively bars, and cozy bistros. Whether you're craving sushi, Mediterranean cuisine, farm-to-table delights, or artisanal desserts, you'll find it all in this vibrant neighborhood.

In addition to shopping and dining, Bethesda Row also offers entertainment options. Catch the latest blockbuster at the movie theater, enjoy live performances at the nearby theaters, or simply soak in the lively atmosphere of this bustling neighborhood.

Conveniently located near the metro, Bethesda Row provides easy access to explore the wider Bethesda area and the greater Washington, D.C. metropolitan area.

With its lively ambiance, stylish shops, delectable dining options, and convenient location, Bethesda Row is a must-visit destination for locals and visitors alike. Immerse yourself in the energetic atmosphere and discover the vibrant charm of this remarkable neighborhood.
description.transit:
Getting around the Bethesda Row neighborhood is convenient and hassle-free. Here's some information to help guests navigate the area:

Walking: Bethesda Row is a pedestrian-friendly neighborhood, and many of the shops, restaurants, and entertainment venues are within walking distance. Take a leisurely stroll and explore the vibrant streets at your own pace.

Metro: The Bethesda Metro Station is located nearby, providing easy access to the wider Bethesda area and the greater Washington, D.C. metropolitan area. From the metro station, you can conveniently travel to popular attractions, business districts, and other neighborhoods.

Parking: The property easily fits 2-3 cars on the driveway. Other parking options vary in Bethesda Row. There are public parking garages available in the vicinity, offering both short-term and long-term parking options. Additionally, some restaurants and shops may provide parking facilities or validate parking for their customers. Guests are advised to check for parking signs and regulations when parking on the streets.

Ride-Sharing Services: Ride-sharing services like Uber and Lyft are widely available in the area, providing a convenient and reliable way to get around the neighborhood and beyond.

With multiple transportation options available, guests can easily explore the Bethesda Row neighborhood and access other parts of Bethesda and Washington, D.C. Whether you prefer walking, taking public transportation, or utilizing ride-sharing services, getting around this vibrant neighborhood is a breeze.
description.interaction:
During your stay, we will be available to offer assistance and support whenever needed. You can reach us easily through the Airbnb app messaging system, where we will promptly respond to any questions, concerns, or requests you may have. We want to ensure that your stay is enjoyable and comfortable, so please don't hesitate to reach out to us.

To provide a seamless and convenient check-in experience, we will provide you with an access code to the house. This way, you can arrive at your convenience without the need for key exchanges or scheduling specific arrival times. The access code will grant you entry to the house throughout your stay, offering you flexibility and peace of mind.

Rest assured, we are committed to making your stay as pleasant as possible and are here to assist you whenever needed.
description.house_rules:
Absolutely! Here's a more friendly version of the rules:

1. Keep it smoke-free: Our home is a smoke-free zone. Please enjoy your smoking breaks outside and dispose of cigarette butts responsibly. We appreciate your cooperation!

2. Respect quiet hours: To ensure everyone's peace and tranquility, kindly keep noise levels down between 9:00 PM and 9:00 AM. Let's create a harmonious environment together!

3. No Parties - Let's keep it low-key: While our home is perfect for relaxation, it's not suitable for parties or large gatherings. There are plenty of places walking distance to have fun. 

4. Report any oopsies: Accidents happen! If any damages occur during your stay, please let us know right away so we can address them promptly. We're here to help!

5. Save energy, save the planet: Let's be eco-conscious by turning off lights, electronics, and air conditioning when not in use or when leaving the house. Mother Earth sends her thanks!

6. Be a great neighbor: Show our property and neighbors some love by treating them with respect and kindness. Your thoughtfulness is truly appreciated!

7. We're just a message away: If you have any questions, concerns, or need assistance during your stay, reach out to us through the Airbnb messaging system. We're here to make sure you have a comfortable and enjoyable experience!

Pet guidelines: We love furry friends! If you're bringing your pets, please make sure they are well-behaved, supervised, and cleaned up after. To keep things clean and cozy, we kindly request that pets stay off the furniture. And remember, they'll need your company and care at all times. Thank you for being a responsible pet owner!

By following these friendly guidelines, we can create a warm and welcoming atmosphere for all our guests. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation!

Humu-Hawa is a very kind and gracious host, and the place,  though somewhat cramped, is kept very clean.

There were, however, a couple things I wish I had known before booking. The first is that parking is, at times, quite challenging. The entire condo complex has very limited visitor parking spaces, and on numerous occasions I would return to find all of them full. With no backup options nearby, my only choice would be to park illegally, then walk around the parking lot every half hour or so until a spot opened up so I wouldn't have to risk being towed.

Second, the walls are quite thin, so the two very young, very fussy children staying in the next room over were often difficult to tune out. They were mostly quiet at night, but rarely quiet during the day. (I believe they're staying in this room until October.)

Overall, the place suited my needs.

hosts.about:
I’m a native of Arlington and DC, though I spent my childhood in the Far East.  My folks were with the American Foreign Service, and we lived in Taiwan and the Phillippines (with many trips to Hong Kong).  During that time, my family collected lots of Asian art and antiques which are featured in the flat.

The flat really is a fun and comfy place to live!  It’s the best of both city and non-city living:  a bike ride away from DC, but surrounded by woods and a block away from two of the best nature parks in the DC area. International biking teams practice in this part of Arlington, so if you like the outdoors, this is the place for you!  

I’m a photographer and filmmaker (also a teacher).  I look forward to meeting you and hosting your stay!

recent.comments: Great location!!! Close to downtown DC but tucked away in a nice quiet neighborhood. Wonderful host.

items.comments: Great location!!! Close to downtown DC but tucked away in a nice quiet neighborhood. Wonderful host.
Was fantastic.  Great location, clean and well stocked.  Couldn’t have had better accommodations.
Everything was as promised ...and the location can NOT be beat ... privacy and lovely and homey and parking....in the DC area that is all the best in one!!!!
Great host. Attentive to any needs you may have. Thanks again

We definitely enjoyed staying at Nans place. It was very clean and the location was very convenient. Nan is very knowledgeable of the area and gave suggestions on the best way to get around and places to visit. She responds to questions timely and her kindness will not be forgotten. We will definitely stay at Nan’s place again if in the area.

I would recommend Nan and her property to anyone looking for a place to stay in the area. She was hospitable in every way. The flat was spacious and clean and so convenient  to the metro. The kitchen was well equipped if cooking there as well.
Suburban, pretty area,; never met Nan, but she was in touch and helpful. Comfortable large space. We were out most of the time , so didn’t spend a lot of time there. Bed/shower good.

description.summary:
BEAUTIFULLY FURNISHED 1600 sq ft 3BR FLAT (PRIVATE UPPER LEVEL ONLY) opens out through French doors to a GREAT YARD in one of the best neighborhoods in North Arlington. MINS from DC and the STATE DEPT LANGUAGE INSTITUTE in Arlington.  TERRIFIC SCHOOLS (Zachary Taylor Elementary School is a short walk away). 

This completely PRIVATE UPPER LEVEL of our two-story home is all yours, with a PRIVATE ENTRANCE and driveway.  BEFORE BOOKING,  pls MESSAGE ME and WAIT FOR A RESPONSE. Thank you!
description.space:
BEFORE PLACING A RESERVATION REQUEST,  please MESSAGE ME and WAIT FOR ME TO RESPOND about availability. Thanks much!

Guests seeking LONG TERM RENTALS (LONGER THAN ONE MONTH) are welcome. Long term rentals three months or over may require a standard Virginia lease and a security deposit. I am negotiable on price. A GREAT HOME FOR SHORT TERM ASSIGNMENTS. Just bring your devices and suitcases  :)  

We have happily hosted many FOREIGN SERVICE GUESTS in the area for language training or short-term assignments, and we are okay with FRONT-LOADED LEASES.  GREAT SCHOOL DISTRICT - Zachary Taylor Elementary School is walking distance away.  The YARD is perfect for kids and doggies. 

************

Featured is a BEAUTIFULLY FURNISHED 3BR FLAT with a GREAT YARD in one of the best neighborhoods in North Arlington, JUST MINUTES FROM DC.  

THE ENTIRE PRIVATE 1600 SQ FT FLAT IS YOURS, with private entrance.  The flat comprises the complete upper level of a two-level house.  Driveway and back yard (with lovely patio and gas grill) are included.  Perfect for family gatherings.

This CHARMING RESIDENCE is situated in a completely safe and private setting in scenic Donaldson Run, next to Zachary Taylor Park and Potomac Overlook. Perfect for long walks, jogging, and biking.... and biking distance from Georgetown. 

A SUPER LOCATION - only 5 mins by car from Georgetown, 10 mins from downtown DC, and 10 mins from the Beltway. THE FOREIGN SERVICE INSTITUTE and GEORGETOWN UNIVERSITY are just MINUTES AWAY.   

EASY ACCESS TO PUBLIC TRANSPORT - Arlington's ART bus (clean and comfy) stops just around the corner and will take you swiftly to 2 major metro stops (Ballston and Clarendon).  From there, you can go everywhere.

IF YOU LIKE THE OUTDOORS - this is the place for you.  Two of the BEST NATURE TRAILS in the DC Metro area are within walking distance of the flat.

3 BEDROOMS and 2 FULL BATHS include a large master bedroom (with QUEEN BED) with flat screen TV and full washer/dryer;  an ample second bedroom (with DOUBLE BED);  and a third bedroom (with DOUBLE BED) that is easily converted to an office, study, or nursery. 

A fully equipped EAT-IN-KITCHEN connects to a charming LIVING ROOM, furnished with Asian antiques and a WORKING FIREPLACE. The Living Room doubles as an Entertainment Center, complete with SMART TV and PREMIUM CABLE CHANNELS. The DINING ROOM comfortably seats a party of six and opens out through French doors to a flagstone patio and a spacious BACK YARD. 

ALL AMENITIES are provided, including high-speed internet and digital cable TV.  HARDWOOD FLOORS throughout.

YARD features a FLAGSTONE PATIO WITH GAS GRILL. A PRIVATE DRIVEWAY comes with the flat.  Safe and free on-street parking is available as well. 

A WARM AND COMFORTABLE ALTERNATIVE TO THE MANY CONDOS IN THE AREA - charming and like home.

ALL EXPENSES AND EXTRAS COVERED, including gas & electric, all utilities, central AC, yard & lawn maintenance, snow removal, high-speed internet, and digital CABLE TV with premium channels. MONTHLY HOUSEKEEPING IS INCLUDED for long term rentals (longer than one month).

EXCELLENT IN HOME DOGGIE DAY CARE is available. Ask me about this. 

Non-smokers preferred (SMOKING OUTSIDE ONLY). Pets seriously considered on a case by case basis.

THE PRIVATE LOWER LEVEL of the house (with separate entrance and no access whatsoever to the flat) is reserved for your host and her two very friendly dogs.
description.access: The entire 1600 square foot upstairs flat is yours!  Private entrance.  Driveway and back yard are included.
description.interaction: I am always available to my guests by text and phone.  I try to respond as quickly as possible to any needs and concerns.  At the same time, I respect everyone's privacy and right to enjoy the premises without interruption.  Have a wonderful stay, and give the place love!
description.house_rules:
Enjoy the place and give it love!  
Additional housekeeping is available for longer-term guests.  Ask the host for details.

Your host has two friendly and awesome dogs.  They live in the lower level of the house with no access whatsoever to the rental flat.

ACCESS: Guests must confirm arrival time within 24 hours of the arrival date. They will be received by your host or a friend at which point keys will be provided, as well as an introduction to the flat.  

Once a check-in time is set, please respect it.  Checking in later is usually never an issue. However, checking in earlier than announced can cause problems, especially if there is a tight turnaround between guests.  Keeping in close contact with your host on your arrival date is the best way to avoid any disappointment or confusion.

KEYS: One set of keys is provided.  There will be a $50 charge for lost keys.

APARTMENT AMENITIES: Guests have full use of the flat and all contents relevant to your stay.  Your host has a full inventory of contents.  Everything borrowed or used must be returned in proper and clean working order to avoid additional fees or penalties.

PRIVACY AND OWNERSHIP: Kindly respect all the contents in the apartment and treat them with care and love.

Ensure that everything is left as originally found. Guests are not at liberty to take anything out of the apartment.

PLEASE KEEP FOOD CONTAINED.  Clean up after yourself and sweep up crumbs as you go!  Please ask your children to be careful with food and toiletries.

RESTRICTIONS: Guests are prohibited from opening the home to unknown individuals without prior authorization. Please contact your host for further details. Failure to heed these restrictions will result in the cancellation of the reservation without reimbursement for unused days.

SMOKING CIGS IS NOT ALLOWED INSIDE THE FLAT:  Please be so kind as to keep all cig smoking outside.

EMERGENCIES: In the event of an emergency, guests must immediately notify the host.

GARBAGE: The garbage and recycle bins are located outside the front entrance. Trash and recycling must be placed curbside prior to Wed morning (early morning!) collection.
 
LAUNDRY:  Please clean out the dryer lint tray after every use!  Also, keep the spin cycle setting on the washer no higher than "medium," for safety.

INTERNET CONNECTIVITY:  Wifi Internet settings will be provided upon walk-through and introduction to the flat.   

NOTES ABOUT THE APARTMENT:
1)  Please keep the front and back porch lights on at all times.

2)  The thermostat and fan for the house are set at temperatures appropriate for everyone's comfort, and with energy conservation (and whole-house humidifier) in mind.  Please discuss with your host if you would like to change the temp.  Your host will always respond in a timely manner to your requests.

3)  The working fireplace in the flat is really fun during the winter months.  Ask your host for instructions on how to use the fireplace before trying to do it yourself.  There will be a small charge of $25 for use of cut and seasoned wood.  Let your host know before check-in if you would like wood.

Mary was a perfect host, very helpful and easy to work with. 100% recommend her and her place!!

I am a repeat guest of Mary’s.  When I am in the area, I look to find out if her place is available first.  It’s a warm, home feeling when actually away from home.  As a single female I feel supers safe.

This is the best Airbnb ever , Mary is super nice and friendly also the place it’s amazing. The house it’s much better than the pictures that show on the app and it’s sweet and comfortable.The cats and dog also super friendly as well ,I will definitely come back to visit the place . Highly recommended!!!!! Thank you Mary and everything .we have a good time.

I love staying with Mary and her sister Rebecca! As a regular, every time I visit, it feels like coming home. The house is spotless and homey at the same time. I greatly enjoy visits to my room from the two cats and also walking around the beautiful neighborhood. The home is nestled in the woods and so peaceful. Yet everything is so close either by walking or driving. I so appreciate that Mary welcomes visitors to her home!
She was nice and smiling.

Mary and her family members are wonderful - friendly, helpful, kind, gracious!  Renters basically share the two common levels of the house with her and each other. It did not feel awkward, no uncomfortable bathroom waits. Rather, it is a homey environment that encourages sharing. The cabin and grounds are a wooded haven in suburbia. The pets are a furry, friendly bonus!  Loved it, and look forward to the next visit.

hosts.about: Judd and I have lived in our house in Centreville for 28 years. We have raised 2 boys into amazing men and sadly watched them leave our home to start their own lives. We loved hosting their friends in the basement for parties, gatherings and sleep overs.  We enjoyed hearing the laughter and cheers through the walls. Since our sons are no longer living here, we have decided to share our basement on Airbnb. We hope that our guests will have as much fun and enjoy the space as much as our children and their friends did. As empty nesters, we have begun to have an appreciation for travel and are excited to share our home with fellow travelers.

recent.comments: Bonnie is welcoming and responsive.  The place is very clean and quiet.

items.comments: Bonnie is welcoming and responsive.  The place is very clean and quiet.
Bonnie has always been a great host and this time was the same! They have a very comfy space and we hope to come back again!
It was a great home away from home! Super clean and a great welcome!

Another great stay at Bonnie’s place.  As a repeat visitor I can highly recommend this lovely finished basement.  It really feels like a home away from home and Bonnie adds some personal Al touches that are really nice.  Convenient location for things in the area and also really good value for money.  Always a very clean and well looked after place you won’t be disappointed with staying here.

We had a lovely stay at Bonnie’s place. There was an issue with the room temperature but Bonnie was super responsive and fixed the problem almost instantly. We would recommend Bonnie’s place without hesitation.

such a convenient location to places to eat, Togo menus ready and waiting for us.. I wish we could've stayed longer. the place was clean and cozy I will definitely stay again when I come to the area again.

This was a nice place with a great location , close to DC. It was very clean and comfortable, with a lovely yard and patio. Really great restaurants nearby. I would stay here again. Be aware, if you want privacy, that there is little barrier between the hosts and guests, so you'll hear their sounds and they can hear yours . And , you will walk through grass that may be wet. A path of some sort would be nice.

description.summary: Full basement of about 1000 square feet of space with private entrance. 1 bedroom with queen sized bed and closet, private bathroom with stand alone shower. Full sized sleeper futon can be made up and available for additional guests. Private living room area with large flat screen TV/cable and access to high speed internet. Pool table and chess table for your use. Kitchenette with sink, microwave, toaster oven, full sized refrigerator and Keurig coffee maker.
description.space:
Space provided will be clean and cozy. Plenty of seating in the living space.  Owners live upstairs and will most likely be home during your stay. No interaction unless requested. Can be as private as needed, but please know that weekdays we will be up early for work. A fan is provided to block out unwanted noise. 
OF NOTE:
~Access to basement requires guests to walk across the grass to the entrance.
~Washer and dryer may be available for lengthier stays (2 weeks or greater) upon request and with some negotiating, but they are not located in the guests' living space so owner must be home and available.
~Deck access can be available upon request as well; however this is shared space.
~Plenty of free street parking available. For your convenience and ease of access, please park directly in front of the house to the right of the driveway.

***I follow Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocol, which was developed with expert guidance. Here are a few highlights:
~I sanitize high-touch surfaces, down to the doorknob
~I use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agencies, and I wear protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination
~I clean each room using extensive cleaning checklists
~I provide extra cleaning supplies, so you can clean as you stay
~I comply with local laws, including any additional safety or cleaning guidelines
description.access:
Guests will have full access to the basement level. Since access is from our side yard requiring guests to walk across the grass, we can arrange a different point of entry if need be due to weather concerns. We have lights to illuminate the area if guests will be arriving after dark.
Our laundry room is located on the second floor and is not available to our guests. This may be negotiated for use during extended stays (2 weeks or greater) if we are home.
description.notes:
We are located perfectly for day trips all around the Washington DC area. We are within 10 miles of 2 metro stops taking guests to DC or you can choose to drive the ~ 20 miles to Washington DC 
Dulles Airport (IAD) ~ 10 miles
Dulles Expo Center ~5 miles
Bull Run Regional Park ~ 5 miles
Bull Run Winery ~5 miles
Air and Space Museum ~ 9 miles
George Mason University ~ 9 miles
Jiffy Lube Live (Live concerts) ~10 miles
W&OD Bike/Hike Trail ~20 miles
Baltimore Harbor ~60 miles
(Fairfax County Permit #193080060)
description.neighborhood:
Quiet single family neighborhood, walking distance to strip mall with several restaurants (Sweet Water Tavern, Bonefish Grill, Chipotle, Chinese, Korean, and Pizza as well),  movie theater, Coastguard Exchange and Planet Fitness. 
**Charging station for electric cars is available at the strip mall mentioned above.
Short drive (1.5 miles) to 2 larger strip malls with a plethora of additional restaurants and shopping opportunities .
description.transit: Bus stop within 1 mile taking travelers to Metro, Vienna metro ~10 miles away and Reston metro ~11 miles away
description.interaction: We will be available as necessary.  We are happy to interact and offer suggestions if needed, although we will respect your privacy.
description.house_rules:
Reminder that we live upstairs, and you may hear our voices, TV, and/or footsteps. We have provided a fan for white noise for your convenience.                          While the basement is roomy, we feel it is best suited for 4 occupants, that is why we assess an additional nightly fee for any additional guests over the 4 limit. 
There is $100 security deposit, please take care of our home and you will not be charged.
Enjoy your stay and come back again!

recent.comments: Misha’s place is very thoughtfully laid out with all the little extra touches including anything you might need in the bathroom, and a beautiful, peaceful pool and back yard. It’s a bit off the beaten path just outside of middleburg and perfect for a little weekend getaway!

items.comments: Misha’s place is very thoughtfully laid out with all the little extra touches including anything you might need in the bathroom, and a beautiful, peaceful pool and back yard. It’s a bit off the beaten path just outside of middleburg and perfect for a little weekend getaway!
Super quaint and clean space.  Misha (host) is fantastic!!!  Super accommodating, friendly and always accessible if anything comes up.  We look forward to coming back soon!

My husband and I had a wonderful time!  We especially loved the amazing pool with diving board and the beautiful grounds of the property!  The area around the pool is well manicured and butterflies are everywhere... very peaceful.

Great time in Middleburg. Beautiful scenery and delicious food nearby. Don’t forget to make time to check out the vineyards in the area. Misha was also very attentive and welcoming. We enjoyed our much needed getaway!
This is a lovely AirBnB in wine country and perfect for a couples getaway.

Misha was a wonderful host! Super accomodating and was spot-on with her recommendations of places to eat! Will definitely stay here again the next time I visit Middleburg! Thank you Misha for making my time in Virginia even more special!

description.summary:
Welcome to Gracecliffe Loft - A very private,  exceptionally clean and bright, detached carriage house loft apartment in the heart of Virginia horse and wine country.  You will find peace and beauty everywhere you look.  Set upon 10 acres of rolling hills, woods, a beautiful stream, and a private fire pit for chilly nights and a swimming pool during the warm months.
Only 4 miles from downtown Middleburg, 5 miles from Salamander Resort surrounded by many wineries and horses everywhere you turn.
description.space: Is a very open spacious Loft floor plan with floor-ceiling windows across entire back wall.  Views entirely into the woods.  Very private, quiet, warm and cozy!
description.access: Guests have access to pool, firepit, beautiful stream and vistas across all our 10 acres and beyond.

name: Luxurious family house Kenwood Park

hosts.about:
Hello, 
My name is  Pamla. We currently live between the UK and the US.  I am happy to host travelers in my beautiful family house when we are away. I will make sure to make your stay as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. 
Long term rentals are also possible.

recent.comments: Pamla’s home is a stellar place to stay. Beautiful home with lots of space—wonderful light throughout the living area that  makes the stay! Area is quiet and in a safe, friendly neighborhood, but close to amenities. The gardens and outdoor areas are stunning. If you need to get to DC or VA this is a good choice too.  We come to the DC area yearly, so we will book again with Pamla. One of my favorite Airbnb stays!

items.comments: Pamla’s home is a stellar place to stay. Beautiful home with lots of space—wonderful light throughout the living area that  makes the stay! Area is quiet and in a safe, friendly neighborhood, but close to amenities. The gardens and outdoor areas are stunning. If you need to get to DC or VA this is a good choice too.  We come to the DC area yearly, so we will book again with Pamla. One of my favorite Airbnb stays!
Amazing house in beautiful setting. Host was extremely kind and helpful. Can not recommend this place enough it was fantastic

Great location, close to restaurants, shopping, parks and grocery stores.  Upscale neighborhood.  Kitchen was well equipped, nice appliances.  Common areas were very nice.  Bedrooms, other than the master, could use some updating. Pamla was away during our stay but always kept in touch and was very responsive.

Palma’s place was the perfect place for our family to come together and celebrate graduation at a nearby university. Local restaurants were great options for breakfast or quick delivery. Ubers into the city were east to order and we never waited over 7 minutes. In between graduation events we found to kitchen to be lovely for preparing family meals. Great place to stay if you’re looking for a convenient commute into DC.

Pamla's place is spacious, comfortable and has all you need to feel like a home away from home. The neighborhood is great. The windows in the main living area look out onto beautiful trees. We saw deer while we were there.

Look beyond the pictures of the front room and kitchen. All the bedrooms furnishings and bathrooms (w/exception of master) are dated. Master has old wood night tables but no lamps to read by. The home has two appearances remodeled in the front (kitchen, living room and master bathroom) every other room is dated with old wood furniture, 1-ply toilet paper, no shower mats. But the biggest issue was old used soap with hair in the shower and black stains on the sheets in master bedroom. The owner admitted his cleaning service hadn’t cleaned the bathroom. The mini tubes of lotion, soap left for use are expired and some half used. The bedrooms did not feel or look refreshed. 
I can not recommend and wish I had selected another home for my stay to bury my mother at Arlington National Cemetery.
Great house with a great host.  Lovely outdoor and indoor space.  Kitchen was awesome. The location was ideal.  Toys in the basement/family room was a bonus for our grandchildren. We hope to be back.

description.summary: Beautiful sunfilled 4 bedrooms plus one bedroom separate in-law suite on lower level. Four and a half baths including ensuite bathroom with the master bedroom. Inbuilt closets. HD screen TV in living room and bedroom. Open kitchen with gas stove.   gas barbecue grill. Large secluded back yard. Quiet and surrounded with beautiful nature.

This was our second visit to Gerri's air bnb and it was just as welcoming as our first. Gerri went out of her way to communicate with us and to provide as comfortable a visit as possible.  She has added more amenities since our first visit, including snacks, a self-care package, slippers and bathrobes.  

We had a nice chat with Gerri and Mike as we were leaving to go see our grandchildren who live nearby.  You will enjoy your surroundings in Reston if you book a stay at Gerri and Mike's air bnb.

This was our 3rd time staying here and it was just as awesome as the other two times! Gerri and Mike have done a great job creating a space that makes you feel right at home. They are so welcoming and kind. We enjoy chatting with them if / when we run into them as we come and go. The neighborhood is lovely. We always feel safe and comfortable. Definitely recommended if looking for a quiet and peaceful stay with great hosts!
Fantastic, well-appointed, quiet apartment in the trees.  Top notch everything and super nice hosts.  I'll be back!

We love this place! This was our 2nd stay, and we’ve already booked our next one! Perhaps the best thing about this place is it feels so homey. That’s likely because the hosts, Gerri and Mike are both so awesome and have created a warm inviting space. It’s quiet, clean and cozy. The neighborhood is beautiful and safe. Parking is easy. We’re looking forward to returning!

What a beautiful peaceful and classy apartment. Gorgeous neighborhood, private, and the most warm and welcoming hosts! This is a perfect place for business travelers who want a home feel in a safe convenient area with hosts who treat you like their VIP guest.

Gerri’s apartment is absolutely lovely - the house is located in a quiet, beautiful, wooded area with nice walking paths nearby. Excellent amenities, comfortable bed and plenty of room to relax in a large, clean, nicely furnished loft above the garage. The loft has its own entrance and is completely private. Gerri and her husband are very nice and accommodating. An A+ experience!

description.summary: Recently built 900 square foot apartment nicely appointed. Surrounded by nature, heavily wooded views, park like setting with a creek out back. The apartment is totally separate from the main house, connected by a covered bridge, with its own private entrance and keyless electronic doorlock. Enjoy outdoor seating areas on the benches in the circular park, the arbor overlooking our hosta garden and on the covered bridge. Located in the prestigious North Point area of Reston and close to shopping.
description.space: Enter to the kitchenette with high top table and chairs.  A large double window over the sink offers plenty of light and another window by the entry door. The kitchen is open to the main living area offering a love seat sofa, coffee table and entertainment center and floor lamps with shelves on each side. There is a triple size window behind the TV that has a pull down cellular shade to the right of the main living area is a hall with a laundry closet with full size appliances. on the left and bathroom with walk-in shower on the right. There is a window at the end of the hall and in the bathroom. To the left of the main living area is the spacious bedroom which you enter through double French doors. The bedroom is outfitted with a queen size bed set and separate work space with desk, manager's chair and monitor. There is also a walk-in closet.
description.access: Guests have full access to all rooms in the apartment and the covered deck outside the apartment. There is a small closet in the bedroom indicated for "Host Use Only".
description.neighborhood: Safe suburban neighborhood of Reston VA. Reston is a planned community established in the early 60's.
description.transit: Parking is free on the street outside the apartment. Buses and metro are easily accessible. Dulles International airport is 15 minutes via the toll road.
description.interaction:
The apartment is attached to the main house by a bridge where we have set up an outdoor casual dining space. We are available when needed however are striving to maintain a contactless arrangement due to the pandemic.

Getting to know our future guests - We ask that you show your current Driver's License or Passport of which we will make a copy for identification verification and documentation purposes only. Also, we would like to get to know you a bit ahead of time. Can you please share some information about where you are coming from, your background, the purpose of your visit and anything else you wish to provide.
description.house_rules: House Rules -No candles or open flame of any kind. We provide a flame-less, battery operated candle. -No smoking of any substance or consumption of illicit drugs.-No guns or other lethal weapons.-Please be respectful regarding noise. Quiet time is between 9 PM and 9 AM. This is a county ordinance.-Do not park in the driveway. There is free parking on the street. Please park across the street from the house. The curb is indented making it safer to park.-Close and lock all windows and the main entry door when you leave the apartment.-Upon arrival, please review, sign and date the Apartment Move-in Inventory List that will be provided as well as general Information Sheet.-Please leave the apartment the way you found it.

We are a company of constant improvement, we don't have the illusion that we are the best, but we try to be better everyday. 
Our team embraces requests, please if you need anything during your stay don't hesitate to ask.

Stella Lux offers luxurious short term and long term rentals in the greater Washington D.C. area. We provide an array of fully furnished, and fully equipped homes designed for your comfort and pleasure. Book a stay with us for a quick getaway, or a long work trip. Stella Lux will be sure to provide the best hospitality services you will find in the area.

This home features 1 bedroom, 1 den (that can be converted into a bedroom), and 2 bathrooms. A bonus - a huge balcony that overlooks the garden. A beautiful home that we know you will love!

description.house_rules:
We welcome all travelers into our home. House rules are set in place for the comfort and safety of both the guest and the host. By confirming this booking, guests agree to abide by the following: 

1. No parties or events allowed. 

2. No smoking allowed. A fine of $350 will be applied if smoking occurs in the home. 

3. No unregistered guests allowed. You are welcome to bring friends and family as long a list of names, and visiting dates are provided to the host. 

4. Please respect the noise curfew beginning at 10 PM. No loud music or elevated voices allowed. 

5. No illegal substances allowed on the premises. Immediate removal from the home will be requested if any laws are broken.

6. Any lost keys, or parking permits will result in a fee of $250 per item.

recent.comments: Charming Colonial style house with some interesting history. Mark saved our day after another propriety proved to be a train wreck. Given we have a 14 month old baby and were relocating overseas that week that was all stress we didn’t need - but luckily for us Mark’s house was available, and in the end proved to be the best choice anyway. It had all we needed, was comfortable, clean and well equipped.

Great place in a great location.  Mark was very proactive and a great host. As an AU alum, I liked the proximity of this place to the campus.  It was around 50 bucks for an Uber to the Museums  which wasn’t bad.  Highly recommend!
fantastic experience for our family of 5!

Unbeatable location and alot of space for the money.
We had a very enjoyable few days at the house.  Mark is an excellent host who offers his home to others graciously and it felt just like 'home' for us.

This listing was better than we expected! There truly weren't many options in this neck of the woods for traveling with mobile elderly parents. This one ticked off all the boxes! It's situated in a sweet residential neighborhood that's close to amazing and diverse restaurants, local and bigger retail shops, with easy access to major roadways and highways as well as sightseeing in and around the DC area. The home has many options for spending time together, is modernized without losing its original charm, and well-maintained! The host was friendly, responsive, and flexible with our check-in, check-out requests.  Highly recommend this listing!

description.house_rules:
Guests must follow and agree to below rules.

Property is equipped with 2 CCTV motion cameras recording live 24/7. One camera is in Kitchen and the other one near main entrance door. 

Guests are NOT allowed to use living room after 10pm.  Watching TV or talking over the phone in loud volume is strictly prohibited. Any violation to this rule will be reported and  host reserves the right to cancel the reservation.

Guests must not leave any trash in the room. All trash must be thrown in the trash bin.

Guests must leave the bathtub clean off hairs and soap residues using hand shower. 

Guests must not leave the water on bathroom cabinets or floor. Water must be wiped off if in case of spill overs.

No laundry access to the guests with less than 7 days stay. 

Housekeeping is scheduled between noon and 3pm. Guests must vacate the room for housekeeping on their checkout day before noon. 
Guests may be allowed to overstay until 2pm if prior approval is taken from the host.

Visitors of guest are strictly prohibited inside the property without prior approval from host.

Number of adults must not be more than what the room was originally booked for.

Guests rating the stay below 5 stars would be blocked from any future booking.

Guests posting 5 star reviews are entitled to 15% discount on their next stay.

Great place for what you pay and very close to airport.

hosts.about: Whether traveling with my family, my dog, or with my friends, I’m very respectful of other hosts and their properties. My husband Chris and I also host a property in Washington, DC.

recent.comments: We have previously rented nearer to the tourist area, and traffic and parking there is horrendous.  This property was completely different.  It is in a very lovely, very green, very lush part of DC near the Potomac and the National Cathedral.  There is plenty of on-street parking right outside the doorstep.  We had a car to visit Mount Vernon and Great Falls (both about 30 minutes, both very worth the drive), so easy parking was essential.  There is not much in the way or restaurants or grocery stores within walking distance, but a plethora within 10 minutes in the car.  The house itself is very cute, with a wonderful sunroom and backyard.  The house is very well equipped with kitchen utensils and accessories, and the outdoor gas grill even worked...a rarity!  Be aware that the ability to negotiate stairs is a must, as access to the bathrooms requires them.  The hosts were very responsive, and anticipated every concern and addressed it before we even brought it up.  Highly recommended.

items.comments: We have previously rented nearer to the tourist area, and traffic and parking there is horrendous.  This property was completely different.  It is in a very lovely, very green, very lush part of DC near the Potomac and the National Cathedral.  There is plenty of on-street parking right outside the doorstep.  We had a car to visit Mount Vernon and Great Falls (both about 30 minutes, both very worth the drive), so easy parking was essential.  There is not much in the way or restaurants or grocery stores within walking distance, but a plethora within 10 minutes in the car.  The house itself is very cute, with a wonderful sunroom and backyard.  The house is very well equipped with kitchen utensils and accessories, and the outdoor gas grill even worked...a rarity!  Be aware that the ability to negotiate stairs is a must, as access to the bathrooms requires them.  The hosts were very responsive, and anticipated every concern and addressed it before we even brought it up.  Highly recommended.

We would give Marissa and Chris's place a "Very Good" rating-in between good and great. An inviting place to come back. The outdoor patio was the most appealing ; loved all the variety of appealing plants/flowers in and around the house.
The house of Marissa and Chris was perfect, the location, the spaces, everything just beautiful. My dog was  so happy there! We will recomend the place to our friends and family!!
Great hosts, good location within walking distance of Georgetown, backyard was great with outdoor fireplace.

I cannot say enough about this listing and these hosts! Absolutely my best-ever Airbnb experience to date. My husband and I are locals—we had to be out of our house for an extended, unplanned home repair and were looking for a quiet place to stay with our dog. What we found was a cozy, warm, adorable, and extremely comfortable home that we really enjoy spending time in! Marissa and Chris have provided so many household items that have made our stay much smoother. The king bed is so comfy, the house is very well appointed, and I’ve lost count of how many cozy blankets there are here. It has been easy to work from home here, as well as to walk our dog (the house is one short block from a “nature trail” along the Potomac). Marissa and Chris are also great—they have been very responsive to messages and are so kind. While we’re looking forward to eventually being able to go back to our own house, we’ll really miss this place!

Very nice and pretty house and good location for walking and biking in DC.  The hosts are very responsive.  Check in and out was very easy.  Street parking available.  One of the bedrooms with the two single beds was in the basement, while one with the crib and the main bedroom was 2 flights up from there, so keep this in mind when planning your travel.

description.summary: Welcome to Clark Manor DC located in Washington, DC. Leave all of your baby and kid gear behind - we’ve got you covered. Have fun and feel at home while visiting our Nation’s Capitol!  Our flexible check-in time and late check out also allow you to maximize your stay.  Conveniently located within walking distance to M Street Georgetown and Georgetown University. You can easily reach all of the museums downtown and you have quick access to the many hiking trails nearby.
description.space: This standalone home has 3 bedrooms, 2 full bathrooms, multiple living areas, a dining room, a private office (sunroom), a finished basement, a laundry room, a chic backyard patio, and a fenced in front yard.   Cozy up to the fire with a hot cup of cocoa or glass of wine. Have fun roasting s’mores or playing board games.  Grill on the BBQ and dine outside on the patio under the string lights.  Enjoy the convenience of being close to the shops in Georgetown and museums downtown.  Take a walk or go for a run down the Trolley Trail. There’s so much history and recreation right outside your front door.
description.access: Full access to the entire house.
description.notes: We request that you let us know who will be staying at the house so that we can make sure to accommodate you properly.   We can provide many baby and kid items for those traveling with their family.  While we do love a good time, sorry, no parties are allowed.
description.neighborhood: The Palisades is a picturesque neighborhood located just West of Georgetown.  It's mostly known for it's many hiking trails and outdoor spaces. And while it’s peaceful and quiet, you still get the ‘city-feel’ through some city noise, air-traffic that flies over the Potomac River, as well as easy access to downtown DC and other parts of the DMV.  You can walk into Georgetown to go shopping along M Street or go ice skating or boating at the Waterfront. Visit the many wonderful museums downtown. There’s a neighborhood farmer's market that takes place on Sundays.  MacArthur Blvd is also lined with delicious restaurants with a variety of cuisines. Neighbors are friendly and the location is unbeatable!
description.transit: There are many ways to experience the Palisades and all parts of DC. There's the metro bus, Capital Bike Share, Uber/Lyft, and of course walking.  We provide bikes for our guests as well.  Please read the owner's manual if you decide to use our bikes.
description.interaction: Promptly responds to texts.
description.house_rules:
- You are free to use the both the indoor and outdoor wood burning fireplaces.  The fire extinguisher is located in the basement laundry room. 

- The maximum number of guests allowed to stay at the property is 5 people.

- Please be mindful of our quiet hours as our neighbors have young families.

- Please refer to the owner’s manual for checkout rundown. 

- Please clean up after your dog.  We have poop bags located in the top drawer of the shelves in the sunroom/office.  Only one dog allowed.

hosts.about: We are a family of 3. We love exploring and traveling and most of all, we love teaching our child to be excited about learning.  We are generally out most of the day, but we are happy to answer any questions about DC, getting around etc.

recent.comments: We enjoy our stay in Deena’s place.

items.comments: We enjoy our stay in Deena’s place.
Excellent location, communication and cleanliness, attentive to the time of arrival, and anything was pending by message in the app
Fantastic, extremely responsive and helpful

Deena was very friendly, greeting me when I arrived after riding 100 miles from Williamsport on the C&O. She brought me ice water and her little daughter brought down some more bottles for me to put in the fridge. It was very much appreciated after a long, fast day.

We made a right decision choosing to stay at Deena's place. It was comfortable,  quiet, everything was well thought of. The location has a great variety of restaurants in a walking/short driving distance. Also not too far from the museums/memorials area in DC. We would book again!
Safe neighborhood, great place if you have a car you need to park. Guest suite has a pocket door that you can close for extra privacy.
Wonderful stay & perfect location for visiting family.  Deena was very welcoming.  The room & bathroom were clean and the bed was very comfortable.  Highly recommend.

description.summary:
This is a lovely bedroom you can enter from the rear of house for complete privacy with it's own private bathroom. It has an attached living room (empty). 
Amenities provided include microwave, toaster, water boiler, fridge, workspace. 
 Nonsmoking home

Your suite includes a  portable heater, fan, desk , a large closet, extra pillows and blankets and plenty of hangers. Iron can be provided.

Across street from Sibley hospital, short walk to starbucks and several small shops and restaurants.

Sibley hospital: across street
Bus line right on Macarthur
Exit and entrance is from the basement rear door, where there is a keyless entry and you will be sent your own code. Then you can cut through the back yard to go to the street, or circle the sidewalk to make it to the street. (it's short and easy, even in heels, I promise!)

Lots of great restaurants in our neighborhood to explore: Aracosia is one of our favorites.

We are a nonsmoking household.

Please enter from rear door.

name: Sage Room, private room in hosts’ house
title: Herndon, Virginia

hosts.about:
Sarah is a writer and editor, specializing in numerous topics, including environmental sciences, travel marketing, and cloud-computing. Stephen is a landscaper and also grows fantastic vegetables! Sarah and Stephen have been guests in many people's homes throughout the US and the world, so they know the qualities that make a good house guest. They're also Airbnb Superhosts! Sarah and Stephen are quiet, clean, responsible, and friendly. They both love meeting new people and exploring new places.

As hosts, we'll make sure your stay with us is enjoyable and comfortable. We'll respect your privacy, and we're always happy to chat or share a drink on the patio. We're especially keen on bicycling and will share what we know about all the fantastic places to ride in the area. We know lots of great places to visit and explore on foot, by car, or by bike!

recent.comments:
This was my first Airbnb experience  and boy did I hit a home run👍.  The room was just like pic and the bed was so comfortable   The bathroom was very modern and straight forward.    You can tell Sarah is an experienced host.  It was a joy to stay there😀


Eric T Bredesen

items.comments:
This was my first Airbnb experience  and boy did I hit a home run👍.  The room was just like pic and the bed was so comfortable   The bathroom was very modern and straight forward.    You can tell Sarah is an experienced host.  It was a joy to stay there😀


Eric T Bredesen

Staying with Sarah and Stephen was such a nice experience. My wife and I were returning from our honeymoon, and our plane had been delayed, so we got to their place very late. They were still so kind and gave us clear instructions, allowing us a great night’s sleep in a beautiful home. We only wish we could have stayed longer!
Loved the space. Sarah was so warm and welcoming. The bathroom was pristine. Terrific visit. The house is lovely.
This is a lovely restful room for a weary traveler. Wholeheartedly recommended.

Five stars for my stay with Sarah & Stephen.  After staying at several Herndon area B&B’s this one was exceptional for the following reasons:
(1)   They only rent one bedroom in the house.
(2) The bedroom was upstairs and I had the whole upstairs to myself.
(3) Full bathroom on the 2nd level - this it was my private bathroom.
 (4). Driveway parking on a widened, paved driveway
(5) easy access to all appliances and fridge.

Thanks so much for a seamless, easy stay!
Amazing stay! House was very clean and the host was extremely accommodating and communicated well. Would definitely recommend.

Very comfortable stay at Sarah’s and it is very convenient to the Dulles airport, restaurants etc. We stayed only for a night and couldn’t enjoy the beautiful garden. Would love to come back whenever we are in the area.

description.summary: Downe House is our private home in a quiet family neighborhood. We support diversity & welcome peaceful folk! Walk to restaurants, grocery, shops, parks. Nearby: bus, Metro, IAD Airport, W&OD Trail. Your room/bathroom are private; shared entrance, back porch, patio, dining room. Registered guests only. Tell us what brings you to town & your estimated arrival time (strictly 4-8 PM weekdays). We cannot do early or late weekday arrivals unless you've been with us before.
description.space:
NOTE: Be sure to indicate the guest count when you book (1 or 2). Also, we have a second room that you can rent for up to 2 additional people in your party. Please ask us for details. We cannot accommodate children under 12 or pets.

The Sage Room:
Queen-sized bed with nightstands
3-drawer dresser with mirror
Desk, bench seat, chairs
Large closet with hangers, luggage stand
Flat-screen TV with built-in DVD and selection of DVDs; Amazon Firestick
Bookcase
Ceiling fan, clock 
Terry cloth bathrobes
Ironing board, iron
Electric kettle, mugs, tea, light snacks
description.access: Ample private driveway parking. Please park at an angle in the gravel section of the drive on the right-hand side. Easy walk to shops, dining, walking/biking trails. Enter the house through our front door with access code, which will be provided upon your arrival. We greet you when you first arrive (strict hours only 4-8 PM); after you check in, you are free to come and go as you please.
description.notes:
We have a fairly strict check-in time (4-8 PM). If you are a first-time guest and you cannot check-in between these times, please let us know when requesting to book. We cannot accommodate weekday arrivals before 4 PM; we may be able to make an exception on Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.

We are quiet people and early risers. We’re also avid bicyclists and can give you some great ideas about where to ride, as well as other information about what to do and see. Smoking or vaping is not permitted anywhere on our property at any time. If you smoke or vape, please book elsewhere.

If you want to get takeout food, you are welcome to eat in our dining room or on the patio or porch. We have a nice outdoor space (3 season) where you’re welcome to sit near the tiny pond and listen to the frogs and the little waterfall. In winter, we sometimes have a fire in the brazier.

If you forget your toiletries, we’ve got you covered.
description.neighborhood: The neighborhood is a mix of old and brand new homes on a quiet, no-through street. Easy walk (half-mile) to historic downtown Herndon, where there's a lot happening throughout the year (check out Friday Night Live during summer). We also have a new brew pub and pizzeria. There's a small arts center that hosts open mics on first Fridays.
description.transit: We're close to bus routes and a new Metro station. We're about 10-15 minutes from Dulles Airport, depending on traffic. If you bring your bikes, we're near the W&OD Trail, plus many other walking and biking trails. You can rent bikes in the area as well.
description.interaction: We'll respect your privacy, and we're also available to answer questions, chat, or share a drink on the patio.
description.house_rules:
1. All guests must show proof of full covid vaccination; no exceptions. Thank you for understanding that you are in our private home with us (which includes an immuno-compromised person).
2. We have a no-shoes policy. You may leave your outdoor shoes in the foyer.
3. Keep noise down after 9 PM, please; we get up early for work.
4. Only registered Airbnb guests permitted.
5. We do not permit children under 10 years of age.
6. No smoking or vaping at any time anywhere on the property.

hosts.about: Married, recently retired!, responsible, respectful of others.  Love food parties. Love to travel and explore.  Love movies, music (esp. Jazz), plays, museums but also love just walking around.  Like to taste new cuisines (and sometimes try cooking them). Love my cats and my family (not necessarily in that order).

recent.comments:
I rented out Karen’s place for 10 weeks this summer as I had an internship close by. It was perfect - short walking distance to everything you need from the grocery store, the red line metro, both NIH and Walter Reed, as well as downtown Bethesda. It’s in a beautiful green neighborhood tucked away so you don’t even notice you’re so close to everything. 

The place had everything I needed for the summer and Karen even had it stocked with everything I forgot or didn’t realize I’d need with her personal touches (like umbrellas and grocery carts). 

Also, Karen was so responsive and kind-hearted. She was proactive and flexible with check-in and check-out, always communicated with me well in advance of needing in the space (which was very rare over the 10 weeks), and included me in the neighborhood activities (4th of July BBQ and many conversations with neighbors). 

Overall, Karen is one of the best hosts I have ever had and the place was perfect for me. Definitely would come back!

Karen's place is amazing! Very clean, well equipped and adequately furnished. The bed is super comfortable.
The house is located in a beautiful green and quiet neighborhood, close to the metro, and also near shops and restaurants. There are many great supermarket options like Harris Teeter and Trader Joe's. 
Karen was a perfect host, responding very quickly to questions and needs. She was very flexible and kind. 
Little details made the most of my stay and like the provision of coffee and tea, and even chocolates!

Karen is kind, thoughtful and considerate. The space has all the little details taken care of, and Karen goes an extra mile to make people from all walks of life feel at home. She allowed us to check out later when our flight was delayed and is always happy to be of help. Would definitely stay again! Feels good to see that good and kind people are still out there

Beautiful place, kind and responsive host. I booked last-minute but we were able to arrange a deal. The place is more spacious than I thought and is very well equipped and adequately furnished. The street is extremely calm and quiet, very green yet just off the main street and  the city action. Included parking was a plus. Overall, fantastic stay.

This place is amazing! It had absolutely everything we needed, was located in a beautiful neighborhood, and was super close to the metro so we could go anywhere we wanted! We also were able to walk around and easily get to shops, restaurants… Everything! This was the perfect place to stay, and Karen was the perfect host! Highly recommend!!
Karen was a great host, she was very responsive and kind. The room was just as pictured, and the location is wonderful.

Karen is a kind host, and I enjoyed my short stay here. Getting to Downtown DC was easy using the metro (Red line), though if you prefer to drive note that a lot of streets have free parking on Sundays! I especially loved the shower and how quiet the neighborhood is.

Walk to NIH, Walter Reed/Navy Hospital, two subway stations, grocery, many restaurants, bars, jazz club, and more. 20 minute subway ride to downtown DC.

Close to everything yet still a quiet, safe, residential neighborhood. Free on-site parking. Nearby bicycles and scooters for rent by the hour. Nearby car rental options, including Enterprise, ZipCar., etc. We have it all! :)

When we arrived, Penny got us started with some treats and food staples so we could take our time getting to the grocery store. The condo is located in a nice neighborhood with lots of nice shops and restaurants. I highly recommend staying at Penny's place.

All of the FIVE stars given for this listing are 100% accurate.  Penny is a thoughtful and delightful host.  She responded quickly before and during our reservation.  She had coffee and food waiting for us for our first breakfast.  Her place is decorated beautifully and not cluttered.  And #1 importance for me - it was so very very clean.  Three of us stayed here in comfort and loved returning every day after sightseeing to this oasis of calm.  Thanks so much, Penny!

An amazing stay, exactly what we needed and exactly as described.  Penny went above and beyond to make us comfortable including have delicious snacks and breakfast items to enjoy.  She is a very gracious host and i hope that we're back in the DC area soon, would definitely rebook.  High recommend

description.summary: Step into a comfortable escape decorated by an artist & lover of interior design. This gorgeous condo has everything you need. Wake up to the warm morning light, enjoy a hot shower,  make a pot of coffee & breakfast or walk just across the street to grab a bite. After exploring all day, kick up your feet & relax watching your favorite program on a 50" screen.  When its time to call it a night, enter a serene bedroom & slip into luxurious white cotton bedding for  a wonderful night's sleep.
description.space: Bright white cotton linens and towels.  Everything a 5 star property would provide and more!  Fully stocked kitchen including coffee, OJ, tea, yogurt, eggs, bagels, cream cheese, butter and jam.   No need to run out if you don't want to.
description.access: The entire apartment is for your use minus one locked utility closet in the hall.
description.notes: I will leave a parking permit for you that must be displayed on your rear view mirror when parking in the lot.  Please make sure to leave in condo before checking out.
description.neighborhood: Walk just across the street where a pleasurable shopping experience awaits you at this unique collection of shops and restaurants. Enjoy food, fun and fashion at Lee Heights 14 fine shops and take in the “mall alternative.”  ARROWINE & CHEESE,  PASTRIES BY RANDOLPH, CHILD’S PLAY, JON DAVID SALON, STARBUCKS, OLD DOMINION PIZZA COMPANY, UPS STORE and more!  Walk one more block to the Labenese Taverna Market in one direction or stroll over to "Livin the PIE life" for the most amazing homemade pastries. Nail salon, gas station, drug stores...literally everything you need is within walking distance.
description.transit: Drive down beautiful tree-lined George Washington Parkway, follow the Potomac river and enter the heart of Georgetown in just 3.5 miles! Location Location!!!  Or walk 5 minutes to the bus stop that will take you into town or the nearest metro several times a day!
description.interaction: I live nearby.  Feel free to contact me if you need anything!!

Please place PARKING PASS and FOB on coffee table.    Slide keys under door after locked and Parking Pass if forgot.  Thank you!!!

recent.comments: The house was beautiful and well maintained. It had everything one needed for a week away from home. Daniel was responsive and helpful throughout the entire week if we needed anything. We would definitely stay here again if the opportunity presents itself.

Beautiful family home with LOTS of open spaces and comfortable private bedrooms with real beds.  The office upstairs worked great for any needed video calls.  The kitchen/living area was our family hang-out.  The basement game / TV room was a hit with everyone.  And the location is so convenient…1/2 mile from trains & 20 min drive into DC.  It’s a real gem.
It was wonderful! We loved the house!

We truly enjoyed our stay. The home is even more beautiful than the pictures show and it was the perfect place to unwind after working in DC 
Plenty do do locally with lots of local amenities close, and within walking distance to the metro. Daniel was a great communicator and was available when we had questions. Would highly recommend

Our stay in Washington DC was amazing with Daniel's house being a family highlight. The proximity to the Metro Station, stores (Safeway and Target) and local restaurants, coupled with the beautiful home and yard in a quiet neighborhood, made our evenings together just as memorable as our time exploring DC by day.  The house was very clean with a well-stocked kitchen, spacious family areas and bedrooms, plenty of bathrooms and very comfortable beds and and furniture.  Daniel was very attentive to any questions we had, and we would definitely stay in one of his properties again if our travel plans allow.
Daniel was amazing host and I can’t wait to stay with him again when our family returns to DC

name: Log Cabin at the Little River Inn
title: Aldie, Virginia

gallery.caption: View of Patent House and Log Cabin (behind) near route 50

Milo and Racer are two donkeys who live behind the Inn

hosts.about:
Our names are Tucker and Mary Ann Withers. We live in the village of Aldie and have been running the Little River Inn for 38 years. We love antiquing, traveling and spending time with our three children, their significant others and our grandchild. We love hosting guests and friends at the inn and sharing our love for Aldie when they visit. At the Inn, a full breakfast is included in your stay, we use local meats, eggs and serve everything from French toast, to quiche, to Dutch apple baby. The Little River Inn features beautiful rooms decorated with antiques, quilts, hooked and braided rugs, spool beds and 19th-century paintings. The Main House features a sitting room with a fireplace, a patio, porches, two breakfast rooms and a spacious yard our donkeys, Milo and Racer, call home. Located across the driveway from the Main House, the Patent House and Log Cabin are free standing cottages that feature full baths and living rooms and working fireplaces. We serve a full breakfast at 8:30 a.m. every day, prepared from scratch by chef Tucker.

Established in 1982.

After moving to Aldie, Tucker learned that his great-uncle’s house was for sale, though the buildings were in poor condition, he decided it would be the perfect Bed and Breakfast. Tucker restored the Main house and cabins, while keeping the charm of the historic property, welcoming the first guests in 1982.

recent.comments: A wonderful place to stay while exploring Aldie & Middleburg, the cabin is so charming and there are cute donkeys out back.

items.comments: A wonderful place to stay while exploring Aldie & Middleburg, the cabin is so charming and there are cute donkeys out back.

We had a wedding nearby and the log cabin was the perfect place for our stay. Mary Ann graciously accommodated an earlier check in and we were able to get ready at the cabin before the reception. The cabin is beautifully decorated and appreciated the little details down to the bathrobes. The breakfast was delicious and the weather was perfect for al fresco dining. We got to spend some time feeding the donkeys which was an unexpected treat. Tucker and Mary Ann were wonderful hosts.
We loved staying with MaryAnn and Tucker. Breakfast was delicious and it was a delight to visit with Tucker. I would definitely come back and stay longer next time.
Wonderful breakfast and great location.

We had the most wonderful night at the Inn! We stayed in the Log Cabin to celebrate our friend’s 50th! We enjoyed wineries and an amazing dinner in Middleburg - and the Inn was truly the best part of the trip!
Rustic in the best way - great place, great location. Loved the wood burning fireplace!

Had a lovely time here! Super charming spot, within 10 mins of Middleburg and quite a few wineries. Perfect for a relaxing weekend away. Only downfall is there is no kitchen but that was made super clear in the photos so we expected that 👍🏻 would definitely come stay again anytime!

description.summary: A full breakfast is included in your stay, we use local meats, eggs and serve everything from French toast, to quiche, to Dutch apple baby. The cabin was built in 1810 and is located across the driveway from the Main House where breakfast is served. There is a master bedroom with a double bed, a bathroom attached, two twin beds upstairs and a working wood burning fireplace. There is also a mini fridge in the living room with some refreshments available.
description.space: Guests are welcome to explore the town of Aldie and of course feed carrots/apples to the donkeys that live behind the Inn!
description.access: Guests will have the entire Log Cabin to themselves and they are welcome to utilize the patio as well as visit the donkeys!
description.notes: The Log Cabin is a part of the Little River Inn in Aldie that has been open for 36 years. We have had many new and recurring happy guests over the years and if you'd like to see reviews from guests please visit Yelp or Facebook and search "Little River Inn."
description.neighborhood: Located in Aldie is an antique shop also run by your hosts, which is called Mercer Tavern Antiques. Greenheart juice shop and the Aldie General Store and Cafe are also located within walking distance. The Little River Inn is located 5 miles east of Middleburg, Virginia, the heart of Virginia’s hunt and horse country. Whether it’s a wine tasting at one of the many vineyards, eating at one of the region’s fine restaurants, taking a tour of a world-class horse farm, shopping in downtown Middleburg, visiting a civil war battlefield or just relaxing in the clean country air, you will find that there is something here for everyone!
description.transit: Ubers and Lyfts are in the area, as well as private drivers and party buses!
description.interaction: We live right in town so we are nearby if you need to reach us!

gallery.caption: Private entrance on the right, there's a small fenced yard outside the door.

hosts.about:
I enjoy continually improving the space so that each guest feels like the first guest.  I've done much of the renovation work myself, and it has been a labor of love!  I also make sure to comply with all local laws regarding renting and I was even involved in the creation of the county ordinance for short term rentals!  That was an interesting process, and it really makes a difference that I live on the premises. 

My philosophy as a host is to provide as much privacy as the guest would like, while also being always available as I live in another section of the house.  

I love being an Airbnb Host as it has been a very happy experience to meet (or text with!) such delightful guests, and it has allowed me to continue living in this wonderful (and unfortunately very expensive) neighborhood.  I have lived in this house for over 25 years, raising two sons, and now it feels very natural to share this great location with travelers from all over the world.  

My favorite activities are hiking in the surprisingly scenic surroundings of DC or spending time outside gardening.  I do spend a good deal of time on my computer as I’m a website designer with a home-based business.   

I love to travel and I've lived in France and Russia, starting out in both places without speaking the language so I know what it's like not to understand what people are saying.  Eventually I became fluent, and then mostly forgot it all, but the lesson that stayed with me is that people can always find a way to communicate.

Fantastic location! Residential street with friendly neighbors just off the busy streets of Bethesda.  Easy access to Washington DC museums/monuments.  Or stay in Bethesda and enjoy the best restaurants!

Blocks away from CVS, Starbucks, Trader Joe's, restaurants, boutique stores, farmer's markets, movie theater. 0.8 miles to NIH and Walter Reed.

description.transit:

If you have a car, you have a selection of scenic drives into DC, as well as easy access to the beltway

Take the metro to museums and monuments ( 8-10 stops depending on which museum you are going to.)  In addition to metro, you can walk to access the bus, free Bethesda circulator, Zip car, and rental car companies.  And uber/lyft cars are always close!

Getting here: 30-40 minutes (check the traffic...) to all three international airports (IAD, BWI, and DCA.)  (DCA has the best access by metro, but there are good shuttle services to all the airports.) Two mile drive to the beltway (395 and 270) Bethesda metro is on the red line - goes straight to Union Station. Vamoose and Tripper both have nearby bus stops for New York City.

Parking is available with advance notice.

Overall we were glad we stayed at Mary's!!!

Our only issues were that he had an issue with the cleaning service that day and so they did not leave out enough towels for four guests. He was able to tell us where to find more in the laundry room so it was easily resolved. Also, only one of the TVs was working while we were there. Overall, it was the perfect spot for two couples and had parking for two cars.
This is the spot for you if you're looking for something walkable. Easy walk to the Metro, grocery stores and restaurants. The bonus of the quiet and friendly neighborhood made our stay great!
Safe, parking and plenty of room.  Good for a dog.

worked out very well. just realized it's about a mile to the Metro. so you either walk or Uber. This takes a bit more time. the place was comfortable enough spent about a week.

Refrigerator was completely clean and spotless,  the "coffee bar fixings" were very appreciated. His housekeeper did a great job of providing a neat and user friendly environment. The appliances were in good working order. We  just had a little moment where we were low on toilet paper our last morning, but a quick email to Neil with his lightening fast response(!) helped us find more in a locked supply area. Parking was no problem and great to always have a spot available in this big city.

2nd Bedroom: located on main level with a queen mattress. 

There is dining room high top table, which can also double up as office space if working from home.

Also not good for romantic couples wanting an evening & night of fun n action. 9pm-7am is quiet time to give guests some rest and peace after their long day at work/sight seeing.
description.space: Pls note there are 13 steps to get to the 2nd floor where the rooms are. Spacious, bright bedroom with large sliding door overlooking leafy back yard garden around a large deck. You will be in a large bright room with natural light in a beautiful suburban home.  Full closet with shelves & hangars on hanging rod. Full bath w/toiletries, tub n shower. Comfy queen bed w/good mattress. Chairs, tables, mirror, lamps, rugs on hardwood floor. Hi speed Wifi. Iron and ironing board available on request. Let me know if you need anything else.
description.access: 5 m from 495 and 270. The house is in Maryland just across the Potomac river from Virginia. We are in a cul de sac. Ample parking in our long driveway-just make sure not to block the garage.
description.notes:
This room is not secluded nor is it in the basement. Its actually right across the hallway from our rooms and adjacent to another guest room. Hence you are requested to please be mindful of not disturbing others with your voices or noises. I will also ensure that you are not disturbed. 
Strict Rule: You cannot bring your guests into my home. 
Check in time is 5-7 pm but ask me if it can be changed for your arrival day. Check out time 10 am.
description.neighborhood: Potomac is one of the most affluent zip codes in the country. It is quiet with low traffic. Property in Maryland but just across the river from Virginia and close to DC. Potomac Square shopping center is good for all daily needs and casual dining. Downtown Bethesda, Gaithersburg, Rockville in Maryland, Tysons Corner and McLean in Virginia, Georgetown in DC within 10 miles if looking for action, shopping, movies and multiple restaurants.
description.transit: Parking free in our long driveway. Uber and Lyft are the best options for public transport. Nearest Metro stop is Friendship Heights in Bethesda at 8 mi. Bus stop to the metro station is 2 miles from home .
description.interaction: This is our permanent home and we have our routine. I will receive you and help you settle down.  I will be accessible throughout either in person or on cell. Prefer to keep to myself but happy to interact, answer questions, or give general guidance about the area. Please do not plan to spend your day in your room. This is a busy household with plenty of activities and noise during the day so it does not always work out for teleworkers or those who just want to relax in the room.
description.house_rules:
You can park to the right of garage without blocking it.  If there is already a car there, then park next to it or at the beginning of the driveway near Brickyard Road. 
Please stay clean and tidy n keep noise level low.  No guests allowed. No one else should enter the house besides the person/s checking in. Check in between 5-7pm. 
Check out time is strictly 10 am. There will be a $10 charge for each extra hour or fraction of it after 10am. If you need this extra time, let me know in advance.
